options.text: He fought bravely on Sa'd's horse al-Balqa', scattered enemy groups, then voluntarily returned and put his feet back in the chains
He fled the battlefield after being wounded and was captured by enemy forces
He was killed in the battle and achieved martyrdom, which freed him from his punishment
He refused to return to the chains and Sa'd had to send soldiers to capture and detain him again

quizQuestions.explanation: Abu Mihjan promised to return to his chains if he survived the battle. He fought heroically on Sa'd's horse al-Balqa', and did not attack any group of enemy soldiers without scattering them. After the battle ended, he kept his promise and returned to voluntarily put his feet back in the chains. This act of integrity impressed Sa'd, who then released him permanently and said he would never flog him for drinking wine again.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a woman with irregular bleeding do if she can distinguish between menstrual blood and non-menstrual bleeding (istihaadah)?

options.text: She should stop praying and fasting during days when the blood is dark, thick, and has an unpleasant odor, as this is menstrual blood
She should always continue fasting and praying regardless of the color, consistency, or smell of the blood
She should stop praying only when the bleeding exceeds 100 milliliters per day measured accurately
She should follow a fixed 7-day menstrual cycle starting from the first day of each lunar month

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the scholars, a woman with continuous bleeding should learn to distinguish between types of blood. Menstrual blood is dark and thick, has an unpleasant odor, and is usually accompanied by cramps. The bleeding of istihaadah is lighter in color and thin. Menses consists of the days when blood is dark and thick, while the other type of bleeding is istihaadah during which prayer and fasting continue.

quizQuestions.questionText: Under what condition is it permissible for a wife to take money from her husband without his knowledge?

options.text: Only if the husband falls short in obligatory spending for her and the children, and she takes on a reasonable basis
If she intends to save the money for the children's education and future needs
If the husband is spending his money on haraam things like gambling or befriending other women
If she needs money to help her parents or relatives who are in financial difficulty

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the hadith of Hind bint 'Utbah, it is only permissible to take from the husband's wealth without his knowledge if he is falling short in obligatory spending. The Prophet (peace be upon him) told her: 'Take what is sufficient for you and your child on a reasonable basis.' If he is not falling short in obligatory spending, it is not permissible to take anything without his consent, as taking wealth without the owner's permission is haraam.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a traveler do if they are uncertain whether the distance is far enough to shorten the prayer?

options.text: Complete the full prayer, as the default requirement cannot be overridden by doubt or uncertainty
Shorten the prayer based on their best estimation of the distance
Wait until reaching the destination to determine the correct prayer length retroactively
Ask other travelers for their opinion before deciding which prayer to perform

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the Shafi'yah opinion, if one does not know and there is nothing to indicate whether the distance is far enough, a traveler is not allowed to shorten the prayers. The completion of prayers is the default requirement and cannot be abrogated or overridden by doubt or uncertainty.

quizQuestions.questionText: Under what circumstances can a strong, able-bodied person from a prominent family receive zakaah funds?

options.text: When the only available work undermines his dignity and status, as it is not befitting for someone of his standing
When he feels the physical labor is too difficult despite being physically capable
When he has worked for at least one year without achieving financial stability
When he has other family members who are already employed

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the scholars, if a person is from a prominent family and the available work is not befitting for him with regard to his status and dignity (because it undermines his dignity), then he may receive zakaah. However, if the work is befitting and others like him do this kind of work, he should not receive zakaah but should be advised to work.
tags: Where Zakah is to Be Spent

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the unanimous agreement of scholars, for whom is sahoor (the pre-dawn meal) specifically recommended?

options.text: Those intending to fast that day, as it strengthens them for the act of worship and differentiates their fast from the People of the Book
Anyone who is awake at the end of the night, regardless of whether they are fasting
Only those fasting obligatory Ramadan fasts, not those observing voluntary fasts
Those who previously missed fasts and are currently making them up

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars are unanimously agreed that sahoor is mustahabb for the one who is fasting, but we do not know of anyone among the scholars who said that it is mustahabb for one who is not fasting. The Prophet did not always eat sahoor, which indicates that sahoor is only mustahabb for the one who wants to fast.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling according to the majority of scholars on stoning the Jamaraat with pieces of concrete?

options.text: Not acceptable because concrete is not rock, unless the piece of concrete contains actual stone within it
Acceptable as long as the pieces are approximately the size of chickpeas
Only acceptable if the concrete pieces are broken from larger concrete structures at the site
Acceptable according to all schools of thought since concrete comes from the earth

quizQuestions.explanation: The majority of fuqaha' stipulated that the Jamaraat should be stoned with pebbles, which are small stones. Concrete is not rock, so it is not acceptable according to the majority. However, Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated that if a piece of concrete contains stone, then there is nothing wrong with it.
tags: Sifat al-Hajj wa'l-'Umrah (Description of Hajj and 'Umrah)

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholarly view favored by Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah, what is the ruling on saying 'If tomorrow is Ramadan, then I am fasting'?

options.text: Valid because the hesitation is about when the month begins, not about the intention to fast itself
Invalid because intentions for obligatory fasts must be based on absolute certainty, not conditional statements
Valid only if the conditional statement is repeated at least three times before going to sleep
Valid for voluntary fasts but not for obligatory Ramadan fasts which require specific intention

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the view favored by Ibn Taymiyah, the conditional intention is valid. The person made his intention conditional because he did not know whether the next day would be Ramadan, so his hesitation was based on uncertainty about the month, but there was no uncertainty about whether he would fast or not.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic rulings on zakaah, when is zakaah due on a shop or commercial building?

options.text: Only if the property was acquired for the purpose of trade (buying and selling the property itself for profit)
On the rental income collected after one hijri year has passed, not on the building itself
On any commercial property regardless of its intended purpose or use
On the building's market value if it has increased significantly over time

quizQuestions.explanation: A Muslim does not have to pay zakaah on his shop, even if its value is great. Zakaah is only due on property acquired for the purpose of trade (buying and selling the property itself). If acquired to buy and sell IN it, or to rent out, then no zakaah is due on it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What does the hadith promise regarding the du'aa said before intercourse ('O Allah, keep the Shaytaan away from us and from what You bestow upon us')?

options.text: That the Shaytaan will never be able to harm the child, but not saying it does not guarantee inevitable harm if forgotten due to an excuse
That the child will have absolute immunity from all childhood illnesses and diseases
That the child will have the ability to memorize the Quran more easily than others
That the child will automatically be counted among the righteous without any effort

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith contains a promise that if this du'aa is said and a child is conceived, the Shaytaan will never be able to harm him. However, not reciting these words does not necessarily mean the Shaytaan will inevitably harm the child. If someone did not say it because of an excuse such as being unaware or forgetting, they will be pardoned, if Allah wills.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah, what is the key difference between listening to music and merely hearing it?

options.text: Listening involves deliberate intention, wanting to hear it and enjoying it, while hearing happens without choice or intention
Listening occurs in public spaces, while hearing only occurs in private settings
Listening involves music with instruments, while hearing refers only to vocal music
Both are equally sinful if the music being played is considered haram

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah explained that the one who listens to music hears it deliberately, wants to hear it and enjoys it, whereas the one who only hears the sound that reaches him without wanting or intending to do so is different. The commands and prohibitions are connected to what a person intends and does, but whatever happens without choosing it has no command or prohibition.
tags: Condemnation of Singing and Musical Instruments

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the Islamic Organization for Medical Sciences symposium, what are permissible uses of human genetic engineering?

options.text: Preventing or treating hereditary diseases through gene surgery or inserting genes into patient's cells for therapeutic purposes
Creating hybrid organisms by crossing genetic barriers between species for scientific research advancement
Modifying genes to enhance physical appearance and characteristics for aesthetic purposes
Tampering with genes to influence a person's character traits and behavioral qualities

quizQuestions.explanation: The symposium concluded it is permissible to use genetic engineering to prevent, treat or mitigate disease through gene surgery or inserting genes into patient's cells. However, it is not permissible to use it to change genetic structure for eugenics, tamper with character traits, or create hybrid beings for entertainment or curiosity.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, when is it permissible to pray on the sidewalk despite it being generally disliked?

options.text: When the mosque is too small and full, leaving no other available place for Muslims to pray
When a person is running late and cannot reach the mosque before the prayer time ends
When the sidewalk surface is cleaner or more suitable than the mosque's prayer area
Only during Jumu'ah and Eid prayers, but never during the five daily prayers

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated that if the mosque is full and there is no choice but to pray in the marketplace or open spaces, there is nothing wrong with that. The correct view is that an exception is made whenever there is a need, so if the mosque is full, people may pray in marketplaces or sidewalks.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Ibn Taymiyah say about a husband who repeatedly has intercourse with his wife during her menses?

options.text: If the husband repeatedly has intercourse during her menses and does not pay heed, they should be separated, just as with a husband who has anal intercourse and does not pay heed
The wife must seek a formal ruling from three scholars before separation is permitted
The husband must be given exactly seven warnings over seven months before separation can be considered
The couple must undergo mandatory counseling for one year before Islamic separation is allowed

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah, if the husband repeatedly has intercourse with his wife during her menses and does not pay heed, they should be separated, as stated in his work al-Ikhtiyaaraat al-Fiqhiyyah. The wife must refuse this haraam act, and this alone is sufficient grounds for separation.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, under what conditions is it permissible to name a child 'Uzayr?

options.text: It is permissible so long as there is no inclination of the heart towards the Jews and no influence from being their neighbour
The name can only be used if paired with another clearly Islamic name as a middle name
It requires prior approval from the local imam confirming the family's religious standing
The name must be avoided entirely because 'Uzayr appears only in negative contexts in the Quran

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Haafiz ibn Katheer stated that 'Uzayr was one of the Prophets of the Children of Israel. The name is permissible so long as there is no inclination of heart towards the Jews and no influence from being their neighbour, despite the name appearing in Surah al-Tawbah in the context of condemning Jewish beliefs.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling if a son's heart is attached to a religious and well-mannered girl, but his father objects without legitimate reason?

options.text: There is no sin on the son if he marries her even if his father objects, especially if he fears his father may object to other marriages too
The son must obey his father's rejection regardless of whether a legitimate Islamic reason is provided
The son must obtain written documentation from his father explaining the objection before proceeding
Permission must be sought from the local Islamic council before the marriage can take place

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clarifies that if the son's heart is attached to the girl and he cannot bear marrying anyone else, or fears his father might object to other marriages, there is no sin in marrying her even if the father objects. This is based on the principle that parents should not prevent marriage without legitimate Islamic reasons.

quizQuestions.questionText: What advice is given to parents and guardians regarding completion of studies and marriage?

options.text: They should not regard completion of studies as an impediment to marriage, because marriage helps a person focus and makes the mind clear
They should require that all university education be completed before approving any marriage proposal
They must provide a minimum of three years financial support to newlyweds before giving approval
They should mandate a waiting period of two years after graduation before marriage discussions begin

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer advises community leaders, parents and guardians not to regard completion of studies as an impediment to marriage. Reality and experience show that marriage helps a person focus and makes the mind clear, and marriage is obedience to the Prophet's command, as stated in Surah al-Noor 24:32.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on weight loss injections during fasting in Ramadan?

options.text: Injections in the muscle or vein do not invalidate the fast, but if administered into the stomach, they invalidate the fast even if not for nutrition
All injections that affect hormone levels and metabolism automatically invalidate the fast regardless of location
Weight loss injections are permissible only if administered at least two hours before maghrib prayer
These injections require making up the fast day even if given in the arm because they suppress appetite

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Fatawa Al-Lajnah Ad-Da'imah, it is permissible to be treated with injections in the muscle or vein during Ramadan as they are neither food nor drink. However, if the injection is administered into the stomach, it invalidates the fast even if not nutritional, as explained in the referenced fatwa.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a Muslim say if they feel they must wish for death due to severe hardship?

options.text: They should say: 'O Allah, cause me to live so long as life is good for me, and cause me to die so long as that is good for me'
Wishing for death is completely forbidden with no exceptions or alternative supplications permitted
They must fast for three consecutive days as expiation after making such a supplication
They should first consult a scholar who will determine if their circumstances permit such a wish

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the sahih hadith narrated in as-Saheehayn from Anas, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'No one should wish for death because of harm that befalls him. But if he must, let him say: O Allah, cause me to live so long as life is good for me, and cause me to die so long as that is good for me.' This is delegating one's affairs to Allah.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, when is concealment NOT required for someone who committed an offense?

options.text: For those known for evildoing who commit sins openly and recklessly, especially if there is fear they will defraud more people
For all non-Muslims who commit crimes, because Islam does not require protecting their honour
Only after obtaining written testimony from at least three witnesses who observed the offense
After waiting 40 days to allow time for repentance before any public disclosure

quizQuestions.explanation: An-Nawawi, Ibn Rajab, and Ibn 'Uthaymeen all clarified that concealment is required for those who appear to be good people, but for those known for evildoing who commit sins openly and shamelessly, their situation should not be concealed, especially if there is fear they will harm others. This applies regardless of religion.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on using interest money for tuition expenses?

options.text: Interest money cannot be used for one's own family expenditure or personal tuition, but can be given to pay tuition for needy students
Interest money can be used to pay tuition for one's own children if they are studying Islamic subjects
All interest money must be destroyed or burned rather than spent on any educational purpose
Interest can be used for personal educational expenses after donating an equal amount to charity

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the fatwa, a Muslim must not derive personal benefit from interest money including spending on family expenditure or educational tuition. However, this money can be spent on needy students' tuition as a form of purification, since it is forbidden to the one who earns it but permissible for those who receive it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the correct view regarding the conditions for wiping over a woman's head cover?

options.text: The head cover does not come under the same ruling as khuffs, and there is no soundly-narrated text requiring it to be put on in a state of purity
The head cover must be put on in purity and can only be wiped for one day when not traveling and three days when traveling
Women must follow the exact same conditions as khuffs including washing the head cover every 24 hours
The head cover can only be wiped if it covers at least 75% of the hair and was purchased for wudu purposes

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn Hazm and ash-Shawkani clarified that there is no soundly-narrated text stipulating the turban or head cover must be put on in a state of purity or that there is a time limit for wiping. The head cover does not come under the same ruling as khuffs because the original ruling for the head is wiping, unlike the feet which are washed.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith of Abu Lubabah, what is the status of Friday compared to other Islamic holy days?

options.text: Friday is the master of days and greater before Allah than the day of al-Adha and al-Fitr, and whoever dies on it is protected from the trial of the grave
Friday is equal in merit to the two Eids, but the day of Arafah holds slightly higher status
The virtues of Friday only apply to those who attend congregational prayer; dying on Friday offers no special protection
Friday's superiority is limited to daytime hours; the night of Friday holds no particular merit

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said in the hadith narrated by Ibn Majah that Friday is the master of days and the greatest before Allah, greater than the day of al-Adha and al-Fitr. Additionally, whoever dies during the day or night of Friday will be protected from the trial of the grave, as stated in the hadith narrated by al-Tirmidhi.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on taking a husband's sperm and his first wife's egg, fertilizing them outside the body, and implanting the embryo in his second wife's womb?

options.text: It is prohibited because it may lead to confusion of lineages if the second wife conceives naturally at the same time
It is permitted as long as all three parties (husband and both wives) consent to the procedure
It was initially prohibited but later permitted by the Islamic Fiqh Council after further research
It is permitted by analogy with breastfeeding, since the second wife would be nourishing the child

quizQuestions.explanation: The Islamic Fiqh Council of the OIC declared this method (the fifth of seven methods) completely haraam. The Muslim World League's Islamic Fiqh Council initially permitted it but later retracted their ruling because the second wife could become pregnant naturally around the time of embryo implantation, leading to twins whose parentage would be unclear and causing confusion of lineages.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on giving zakaah (obligatory charity) to people who are strong and able to earn a living but refuse work?

options.text: Zakaah cannot be given to those who are strong and able to earn, as the Prophet said there is no share of zakaah for one who is able to earn a living
Zakaah may be given to anyone who asks for it regularly, regardless of their ability to work
Both zakaah and voluntary charity must only be given to those who are completely unable to work
Zakaah can be given to able-bodied people if they have become accustomed to receiving monthly charity

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) explicitly stated: 'There is no share of it [zakaah] for the one who is independent of means or one who is strong and able to earn a living' (narrated by Abu Dawood, 1633). However, voluntary (mustahabb) charity may be given to both poor and rich, though it is better to give it to those in need. This is the clear distinction made in Islamic law between obligatory and voluntary charity.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on naming a child 'Rukaan'?

options.text: There is nothing wrong with the name Rukaan unless it is proven to be a gate of Hell, in which case it becomes makrooh (disliked)
The name Rukaan is confirmed as one of the gates of Hell and is therefore completely forbidden
Only the spelling 'Rukaanah' is permissible in Islam, not 'Rukaan'
All traditional Arab names like Rukaan are automatically acceptable regardless of their meanings or associations

quizQuestions.explanation: Scholars have stated that there is nothing wrong with calling a child Rukaan, as it is among recognized Arab names (including Rukaan, Rukaanah and Rakeen). The claim that it is a gate of Hell has not been verified. However, if it were proven to be the name of a gate of Hell, then it would become makrooh (disliked) to use this name, following the Islamic principle of choosing good and appropriate names for children.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic belief, what happens if the Prophet (peace be upon him) made an incorrect decision in religious matters?

options.text: Revelation would come down immediately to correct it and show Allah's ruling, as proven in Quranic passages about prisoners at Badr and other incidents
The Prophet could make permanent errors in religious rulings without any divine correction being necessary
Such mistakes would be corrected only after his death by the consensus of scholars
Following the Prophet's rulings is recommended but not obligatory, so errors would not require correction

quizQuestions.explanation: The Sunnah of the Prophet (peace be upon him) in religious matters is infallible because if he made a decision based on personal opinion that was incorrect, revelation would come down straightaway to correct it. This is proven in the Quran through passages such as the verses about prisoners at Badr (Al-Anfal 8:67-69), asking forgiveness for polytheists (At-Tawbah 9:113-114), and prohibiting what Allah made lawful (At-Tahrim 66:1-2). This demonstrates the divine protection of his religious teachings.

quizQuestions.questionText: Under what conditions is hemp protein permissible to consume according to Islamic ruling?

options.text: If derived from seeds or leaves not attached to flowering tops, which are free of THC according to the 1961 Narcotic Drugs Convention
All parts of the hemp plant contain THC and are therefore completely forbidden for consumption
Only protein extracted from the flowering and fruiting tops of hemp is permissible
Hemp protein is permissible only if derived from male cannabis plants, not female plants

quizQuestions.explanation: The psychoactive substance THC (tetrahydrocannabinol) is only present in the flowering or fruiting tops of the cannabis plant, not in the seeds or leaves. The Single Convention on Narcotic Drugs of 1961 explicitly excludes seeds and leaves (when not attached to the tops) from the definition of prohibited 'cannabis.' Therefore, protein derived from these THC-free parts of the plant is permissible, provided it has no other harmful effects on the body.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a Muslim do who swore to give his hijrah (migration) money to charity if he committed a sin, but then committed the sin again?

options.text: Proceed with migration, offer expiation (kaffarah) for breaking the oath, and use the money for hijrah since its benefit outweighs the oath
Give all the migration money to charity because breaking an oath is never permissible under any circumstances in Islam
Delay migration indefinitely until new money is raised, as keeping the oath takes absolute precedence
Keep the money without expiation since oaths made in desperation are automatically void

quizQuestions.explanation: Islamic law prescribes that when someone swears an oath and then sees something better, they should do what is better and offer expiation for the oath. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever swears an oath then sees that something else is better than it, let him do that and offer expiation for his oath' (Muslim 1650). Migration to a Muslim land and its benefits take precedence over maintaining the oath, so he should offer kaffarah yameen (expiation) and proceed with hijrah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling for a man with low sexual desire who wishes to marry?

options.text: He may marry if he can have intercourse even once every month or two, but complete inability must be disclosed to the woman's guardian beforehand
Any degree of sexual difficulty or low desire automatically prevents marriage according to Islamic law
Low desire requires ability to have intercourse at least once per week for marriage to be permissible
Complete inability to have intercourse need not be disclosed before marriage as it may resolve itself

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn Jibreen's fatwa, if a man has any sexual desire at all, even if little, he may get married. It is sufficient to be able to have intercourse even once every month or two months, as there are natural variations in desire among people. However, if there is complete inability to have intercourse, Islamic law requires that this must be clearly disclosed to the woman's guardian before the marriage contract takes place, to ensure transparency and informed consent.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the correct procedure when buying gold from a craftsman who will also make it into jewellery?

options.text: The price of the gold must be paid immediately in cash and possession taken in one sitting, but the cost of crafting may be delayed
Both the gold price and the crafting fee must be paid immediately in the same sitting to avoid riba
The gold price can be delayed as a debt, but the crafting fee must be paid up front
Exchanging old gold for new gold with an added crafting fee is permissible as long as the exchange happens in one sitting

quizQuestions.explanation: Based on the hadith 'Gold for gold, silver for silver... like for like, same for same, hand to hand,' the price of gold must be paid in cash with immediate possession in one sitting to avoid riba. However, as Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen explained, the cost of making gold into jewellery is payment for work (labor), not an exchange of gold for gold, so this fee does not have to be paid up front and may be delayed. Mixing gold exchange with a labor fee as a single deferred payment would constitute riba.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the tafsir of Surah Al-Waqi'ah (56:7-10), what is the status of those who are 'foremost' on the Day of Resurrection?

options.text: They will be the first to enter Paradise, closest to Allah in the heights of 'Illiyeen, in a lofty status above which there is no higher
They will be among those on the Right Hand who receive their records and enter Paradise after accountability
They will form a fourth separate group distinct from the three divisions mentioned in the verses
They will serve as witnesses over the other two groups before entering Paradise themselves

quizQuestions.explanation: The tafsir explains that those who were foremost in doing good deeds in this world will be foremost (first) in the Hereafter. They will be the first to enter Paradise and will be the closest to Allah in gardens of delight, in the heights of 'Illiyeen, occupying the loftiest status with no higher status above it. This distinguishes them as the highest rank among the three groups mentioned in the verses, above even the general 'people of the Right Hand.'

quizQuestions.questionText: When is an agent (wakeel) liable for the loss of items entrusted to his care, such as a watch in luggage?

options.text: Only if the loss was due to heedlessness, such as leaving the bag unattended in a vulnerable location or not standing over it in baggage claim
Agents are always liable for any loss of items entrusted to them, regardless of the circumstances or their level of care
The buyer must pay the full remaining amount to the agent even if the agent left the bag completely unguarded
An agent who forgets to list an item on airport loss forms is automatically considered negligent and fully liable

quizQuestions.explanation: Islamic law establishes that a wakeel (agent) is a trustee who is not liable for loss or destruction unless there is deliberate transgression or negligence. As Ibn Qudaamah stated, 'The agent is a trustee; he is not liable for the loss or destruction of anything entrusted to his care if he is not negligent.' Therefore, liability depends on whether the loss resulted from heedlessness (like leaving a bag where it was vulnerable to theft) or occurred despite proper care. The scholars advise that parties reach a mutually acceptable agreement when circumstances are unclear.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on investing in bitcoin according to the scholars' assessment?

options.text: The ruling cannot be determined because bitcoin's source is unknown and surrounded by mystery, so investment is not advised until its true nature is revealed
Bitcoin is clearly halal since many major companies have begun to recognize and deal in it
Bitcoin is definitively haram due to its purely digital nature and lack of any physical commodity backing
Muslims may freely invest in bitcoin as long as they avoid using it for transactions involving riba or prohibited goods

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars stated that bitcoin's source remains unknown and it is surrounded by mystery, problems, fears and dangers. Because the facts of the matter are not clear and it is not known who is behind it, they are unable to issue a definitive fatwa concerning it. Therefore, they advise against investing in it until its true nature becomes apparent. This represents a cautious approach based on insufficient information rather than a definitive ruling of halal or haram.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on playing with Ouija boards?

options.text: It is forbidden because it involves calling upon jinn and asking them about unseen matters, similar to consulting fortune tellers
It is allowed as mere entertainment if the player doesn't believe the disc movements are real
It is permissible if done only occasionally and the player seeks permission before leaving the game
It becomes prohibited only if the player performs acts of worship to the jinn during the game

quizQuestions.explanation: Playing with Ouija boards is haram because it involves calling upon and addressing jinn, asking them about unseen matters, and believing their words. The ruling is the same as going to fortune tellers and soothsayers. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) warned against this and stated that going to such people, even without believing them, means no prayer will be accepted for forty days.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a Muslim woman working in a home for the elderly where she must serve alcohol and pork to residents?

options.text: It is forbidden because it involves serving alcohol and pork, and the Prophet cursed those who carry and serve wine
It is permissible if she avoids serving alcohol and pork but performs other duties like washing and changing diapers
It is allowed on grounds of necessity since working is better than depending on social welfare agencies
It becomes permissible if she wears a headscarf and knee-length shirt, even if not complete hijab

quizQuestions.explanation: This work is forbidden because the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed ten types of people with regard to wine, including the one who carries it and the one who pours it. When Allah forbids something, He also forbids its price. Additionally, the work involves not wearing complete shar'i hijab and potentially seeing and touching awrah of residents. Accepting help from social institutions is considered easier to bear than this work which goes against sharee'ah.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic scholars, what are the requirements for proper Islamic dress for women?

options.text: It must cover the whole body, be thick and loose, not decorated or perfumed, and not resemble men's or unbelievers' dress
It must cover the whole body and be loose, but may be decorated if it's traditional cultural attire
It should be non-transparent and cover the body, but tight clothing is acceptable if not revealing
It must avoid crosses and animal depictions, but perfume is permissible for married women

quizQuestions.explanation: Scholars have specified nine requirements for the Muslim woman's proper dress from the Quran and Sunnah: (1) cover the whole body, (2) be thick/non-transparent, (3) be loose not tight, (4) not be decorated to attract onlookers, (5) not be perfumed, (6) not be libas al-shuhrah (garment of fame), (7) not resemble men's dress, (8) not resemble unbelievers' dress, and (9) not bear crosses or depictions of beings with souls (humans, animals).

quizQuestions.questionText: Is it permissible for the husband's brother to take his brother's wife to the doctor if the husband is not available?

options.text: It is forbidden because traveling alone with the husband's brother is khulwah (prohibited seclusion with a non-mahram)
It is permissible if the hospital is in the same city and the journey is brief
It is allowed if the husband cannot be there and it's a medical necessity
It becomes permissible if they keep the car windows open and avoid conversation during the trip

quizQuestions.explanation: It is not permissible for the wife to travel in a car alone with her husband's brother because that is khulwah (being alone with a non-mahram). The Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) warned: 'Beware of entering upon women.' When asked about the in-law, he said: 'The in-law is death.' This applies whether in a car or in a house. Additionally, it is haram for a woman to travel without a mahram, based on the hadith of Ibn Abbas.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on mentally translating the meaning of Quranic verses into one's own language during prayer?

options.text: It is permissible to ponder the meaning silently in your own language, but speaking it aloud is forbidden as prayer allows only tasbeeh, takbeer and Quranic recitation
It is prohibited entirely because translating meanings during prayer, even mentally, interrupts the required focus
It is permissible to say the translation quietly in naafil prayers, but completely forbidden in obligatory prayers
It is allowed to recite the translation aloud if doing so helps with understanding and concentration

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing wrong with reciting a verse during prayer and pondering its meaning in your own language, saying it to yourself. This comes under the heading of pondering and thinking of the meaning. However, you must not utter it out loud, because speaking is forbidden during prayer. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: 'This prayer is not the right place for any of the people's speech, rather it is tasbeeh, takbeer and recitation of Qur'aan.' Additionally, it is not permissible to recite Qur'an in any language other than Arabic.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the status of reciting Al-Fatihah in the funeral prayer according to the scholars mentioned?

options.text: It is considered obligatory by many scholars based on the hadith 'There is no prayer for the one who does not recite the Opening of the Book'
It is not recommended under any circumstances, as held by Abu Hanifah and Malik
It is recommended but not obligatory, and saying Du'a without reciting it is permissible
It is obligatory only if the funeral prayer is performed in congregation, not when praying individually

quizQuestions.explanation: The correct view is that reciting Al-Fatihah is a pillar or essential part of the funeral prayer, based on the general meaning of the Prophet's words (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): 'There is no prayer for the one who does not recite the Opening of the Book.' The funeral prayer is called a prayer in the Quran. Ibn Abbas used to recite it out loud to demonstrate it should be recited, saying 'So that you will know that it is Sunnah.' Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin and Shaykh Ibn Baz both stated it is obligatory.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on abortion for a mother who has AIDS?

options.text: It is not permissible because AIDS is not usually transmitted until later pregnancy stages or during delivery, after the soul has been breathed into the child
It is permissible in early stages to protect the unborn child from contracting the disease
The mother should not breastfeed or care for the child because of the definite risk of transmission
Neither spouse has the right to annul the marriage since AIDS transmission only occurs through blood contact, not ordinary interaction

quizQuestions.explanation: Abortion is not permissible for a mother who has AIDS because the disease is not usually transmitted by the mother to the fetus until the later stages of pregnancy  after the soul has been breathed into the child  or during delivery. However, there is no reason from a sharee'ah perspective why the mother should not take care of her child and breastfeed him, so long as there is no medical report stating otherwise, since ordinary mixing poses no definite risk. The wife does have the right to demand separation from a husband with AIDS since it is transmitted primarily through sexual contact.

quizQuestions.questionText: Is the wife obligated to obey her husband when he calls her to play with him (non-sexual intimacy)?

options.text: She must obey him because it helps perpetuate love and harmony, and is among the valid actions mentioned in hadith alongside shooting arrows and training horses
She is only required to obey him for intercourse specifically, but playing together is merely recommended
She must obey only if his request doesn't interfere with her household duties or worship obligations
Her obedience in this matter is optional since it falls under entertainment, not marital obligations

quizQuestions.explanation: The wife must obey her husband when he calls her to play with him, as this helps perpetuate love and harmony between spouses. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) mentioned playing with one's wife as one of three valid and purposeful actions (along with shooting arrows and training horses), unlike other forms of entertainment which are pointless. This is part of her obligation to obey him in what is right and proper, and is a means of keeping him chaste, fulfilling marriage objectives, and following what the Lawgiver has recommended. Refusal creates resentment and could expose her to Allah's wrath.

quizQuestions.questionText: Who is responsible for paying zakaat al-fitr for workers employed in a factory or farm?

options.text: The workers must pay zakaat al-fitr for themselves because the basic principle is that it is obligatory upon each individual
The factory or farm owner should pay zakaat al-fitr on behalf of workers since they are under his employment
Zakaat al-fitr should be split equally between the employer and employee
The employer must pay it if the workers' wages are below a certain threshold

quizQuestions.explanation: The workers who are paid wages in return for their work in the factory and on the farm are the ones who should pay zakaat al-fitr for themselves, because the basic principle is that it is obligatory upon them. The employer does not have to pay it on their behalf. This is based on the fundamental ruling that zakaat al-fitr is an individual obligation on each Muslim who has the means.

quizQuestions.questionText: If a person wakes up junub shortly before Fajr prayer ends and fears he will miss the prayer time if he does ghusl, what should he do?

options.text: He must do ghusl even if the prayer time ends, because the time for prayer in his case begins when he wakes up, not when dawn breaks, since he is excused
He may do tayammum if he fears missing the congregational prayer, as tayammum is valid when time is limited
He should do wudu only and pray with the congregation, then do ghusl and repeat the prayer at home
He may delay ghusl until after sunrise if he wakes up within five to ten minutes before Fajr ends

quizQuestions.explanation: The person who is junub must do ghusl to pray, and the prayer is not valid with only wudu. He must do ghusl even if he fears the prayer time will end. The majority of scholars hold the correct view that he is obliged to do ghusl because he is excused. The time that counts for him is when he woke up, based on the hadith: 'If any one of you forgets to pray, or sleeps and misses a prayer, then let him pray when he remembers.' For the one who slept, the time for prayer begins when he wakes up, not when the dawn breaks, because he is excused.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on a lawyer defending clients in legal cases?

options.text: A lawyer should only defend clients who are in the right and must not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves or try to prevent hadd punishments from being carried out
A lawyer can defend any client regardless of whether their case is true or false, as long as they are paid a fee for their representation services
A lawyer must refuse all cases involving criminal matters because the Prophet forbade Muslims from representing others in disputes
A lawyer can defend clients in wrongdoing as long as they privately advise them to fear Allah, even if they publicly argue the false case in court

quizQuestions.explanation: The practice of law is permissible when defending those in the right, but forbidden when defending falsehood. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) warned that whoever argues for a false case knowingly will remain subject to Allah's wrath, and anyone whose intercession prevents a hadd punishment has opposed Allah. A Muslim lawyer must fear Allah and not defend wrongdoing.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should the owner of a caf do if men and women are mixing in his establishment?

options.text: The caf owner should prevent the mixing, restrict the caf to men only, or seek other permissible work, as allowing mixing is a sin even though he has refused to sell forbidden items
The caf owner has fulfilled all Islamic requirements by refusing to sell cigarettes and forbidding things against Islamic etiquette, so the mixing is now permissible
The caf owner can continue allowing mixing as long as he privately feels uneasy about it and fears Allah in his heart without taking action
The caf owner should designate separate doors for men and women to enter the caf, which will make the mixing permissible like in the mosque

quizQuestions.explanation: The Quran and Sunnah indicate that mixing is haraam. Allah says to ask the Prophet's wives from behind a screen as it is purer for hearts. The Prophet separated men and women in mosques and designated a door specifically for women. If these precautions apply in the pure place of worship, they are even more important elsewhere. The caf owner must prevent mixing, restrict to men only, or find other work.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a woman who committed adultery and is now contemplating suicide do?

options.text: She must verify that both her divorce and current marriage contract are valid according to sharia, repent sincerely, do good deeds, and never consider suicide as it is a grievous major sin that leads to eternal punishment
She should immediately separate from her current husband because a marriage between two people guilty of adultery can never become valid even after sincere repentance
She has committed such a grave sin that Allah's mercy cannot reach her, so she should focus only on doing good deeds for the rest of her life
She should confess her adultery publicly to the Islamic authorities so they can carry out the hadd punishment, as this is the only way to expiate her sin

quizQuestions.explanation: A marriage between two people guilty of adultery is not valid unless they have repented, so the contracts must be verified and repeated if necessary. Allah will forgive all sins if she is sincere in repentance and determined never to repeat it. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) warned that whoever kills himself will be doing that same action in the Fire of Hell for all eternity, making suicide one of the most grievous major sins.

quizQuestions.questionText: Who was the first Caliph after the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and what was the significance of Ghadeer Khum?

options.text: Abu Bakr was the first Caliph by consensus of the Sahabah, and the Prophet's advice at Ghadeer Khum was to honor his household, not to give them preference over more virtuous companions like Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman
Ali was the first Caliph as designated by the Prophet at Ghadeer Khum, but the Sahabah rejected this designation and chose Abu Bakr instead, causing the initial dispute
The initial dispute between the Muhaajireen and Ansaar was about whether to give bay'ah to Ali or Abu Bakr, and they eventually compromised by choosing Abu Bakr first
The people of the Prophet's household mentioned at Ghadeer Khum are to be given preference in positions of leadership over other Sahabah like Abu Bakr and Umar

quizQuestions.explanation: Abu Bakr al-Siddeeq was the first Caliph according to the consensus of scholars and the unanimous bay'ah of the Sahabah. None of the Sahabah asked to give bay'ah to Ali after Abu Bakr or after Umar. At Ghadeer Khum, the Prophet reminded people about his household (family of Ali, Aqeel, Ja'far, and Abbas), which means honoring and respecting them, but not giving them preference over those known to be more virtuous.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on disturbing graves found on one's land?

options.text: It is not permissible to disturb the graves by digging up the remains, walking over them, or any form of disrespect, and a fence should be erected to preserve their dignity as the sanctity of the dead is like the sanctity of the living
The graves can be moved to another location as long as the remains are handled respectfully and reburied in a proper graveyard with proper Islamic burial rites
The landowner has the right to remove the graves if he owns the land title, but he must notify the families of the deceased first to give them time to relocate the remains
Walking over the graves is permissible as long as no damage is done to the grave markers or tombstones, but digging up the remains is absolutely forbidden

quizQuestions.explanation: Those buried own the land by virtue of being buried there, and it is not permissible to disturb them whether by digging up remains, walking over graves, or any other form of disrespect. A fence should be put up around the graves to prevent disrespect and preserve their dignity, because the sanctity of the dead among the Muslims is like the sanctity of the living.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on praying on a prayer mat?

options.text: Praying on a mat is permissible in principle, but becomes problematic if the mat contains images of animate beings, has distracting decorations, or if one insists on using it thinking it's essential when this was not the way of the salaf
Praying on a mat is always recommended because it protects the worshipper from impurity on the ground and helps maintain proper focus and humility in prayer
The Prophet always used a prayer mat and never prayed directly on the ground, so Muslims should follow this sunnah by always using a mat for their prayers
Having a special mat for the imam in the mosque is recommended because it helps distinguish him from other worshippers and shows proper respect for his leadership position

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prayed on mats, carpets, and animal pelts, showing it is permissible. However, it becomes impermissible if the mat has images of animate beings, makruh if it has distracting decorations, and problematic if one insists it's essential. The Prophet prostrated in mud and water showing humility. At the time of the salaf, none had a rug just for prayer; Imam Malik even said spreading a rug in the mosque is bid'ah.

quizQuestions.questionText: Can a lender accept repayment from an interest-based bank when the debtor transferred the debt to that bank?

options.text: The lender may take his money from the bank because he is not a party to the interest-based transaction between the bank and the debtor, though he should try to advise both parties about the prohibition of interest
The lender must refuse to take the money from the bank because any involvement with an interest-based institution makes the money haram for him to accept
The lender can take the money only if he donates an equivalent amount to charity to purify it from the interest contamination before using it
The lender must first investigate how much interest the bank charged the debtor and subtract that amount before accepting the payment to avoid benefiting from riba

quizQuestions.explanation: It may be permissible for the lender to take what he is owed from the bank because he is not a party to the interest-based transaction that occurred between the bank and the debtor. However, he should try to advise both parties about the prohibition of interest in Islam.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on professional boxing?

options.text: Boxing is haram because it involves attacking the face which the Prophet forbade, causes irreparable harm including brain and nerve damage, wastes time and money, and involves uncovering the awrah of both fighters and spectators
Boxing is permissible if done only against non-Muslims and with the intention to prepare for jihad, as this makes it a legitimate form of training for defending Islam
Boxing is permissible as long as the boxer uses the money earned for charity and speaks about Islam to encourage the youth to follow the right path
Boxing is permissible if the fighter covers his awrah properly from navel to knee and makes an effort to avoid hitting the opponent's face directly during matches

quizQuestions.explanation: Boxing is the worst of sports because: (1) it involves attacking the face which the Prophet specifically forbade; (2) it wastes time that Allah will question us about; (3) it causes irreparable damage including permanent brain and nerve injuries; (4) it involves uncovering the awrah from navel to knee; (5) it wastes money. The Prophet said 'avoid the face' and 'there should be no harm.' For jihad preparation, one can strengthen the body with other sports that are not haram.

quizQuestions.questionText: How should a woman determine whether bleeding caused by abortion pills requires her to stop praying?

options.text: If the bleeding has menstrual characteristics (deep red, thick, characteristic smell) it is menses and she cannot pray or fast, but if it's light red with no smell it is istihaadah and she should wash, do wudoo', and pray while wearing sanitary pads
All bleeding caused by abortion pills is considered istihaadah regardless of its color or smell, so the woman must continue praying and fasting in all cases
All bleeding caused by abortion pills is considered menstrual blood regardless of its characteristics, so the woman must stop praying and fasting until the bleeding completely stops
The woman should wait fifteen days to see if the bleeding continues, and only then determine if it is menses or istihaadah based on the duration rather than the blood characteristics

quizQuestions.explanation: Scholars favor examining the blood: if it has menstrual characteristics (deep red, thick, with characteristic smell), it is menstrual blood and she cannot pray, fast, or have intercourse. If it is light red with no smell, it is istihaadah (non-menstrual bleeding) and she should wash, do wudoo', pray, and wear sanitary pads. The same ruling applies to bleeding after surgery. Any bleeding beyond 15 days is istihaadah according to the majority.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling when a husband resorts to masturbation because his wife frequently refuses intimacy?

options.text: The wife is obliged to respond to her husband unless she has a valid excuse like menstruation, sickness, or observing an obligatory fast; masturbation by the husband's own hand is prohibited, but the wife can use her hand to satisfy him as this is permissible enjoyment
The husband has the right to masturbate by his own hand if his wife refuses him for any reason, as this is better than falling into the greater sin of adultery
The wife can refuse her husband's call to bed whenever she feels tired or lazy to make ghusl, as forcing herself to comply would harm her and Islam prohibits harm
If the wife refuses without a valid excuse, the husband should immediately refer the matter to a judge rather than trying to communicate with her about their Islamic rights and duties

quizQuestions.explanation: The wife is obliged to obey when her husband calls her to bed, and if she refuses the angels curse her until morning. However, she is not sinning if she has a valid excuse (menstruating, sick and likely harmed, or observing obligatory fast). Masturbation by one's own hand is prohibited, but there is no sin if the wife uses her hand to satisfy him, as the verse permits enjoying one's wife. Both spouses should communicate frankly about rights and duties in a kind, loving manner.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should you do if you find yourself thinking about zina (fornication/adultery)?

options.text: Strengthen your faith through reading Quran and voluntary prayers, fast if unmarried, choose righteous friends, and avoid things that provoke desire like haram looking
Ignore the thoughts completely as they are merely passing thoughts that cross the mind and require no action
Focus solely on remembering the punishment of zina without taking any practical preventive steps
Marriage is the only solution and nothing else is required once you get married

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer distinguishes between mere thoughts and established thoughts with resolve. For established thoughts with intention, one must take multiple steps: strive to get married (the shar'i and natural protection), fast if unable to marry, strengthen iman through worship, choose righteous friends, keep away from things that provoke desire (especially haram looking), and remember the punishment for zina.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman who wore niqaab during Hajj because she was unaware it was not allowed?

options.text: There is no sin on her because she was unaware, and she does not have to offer any fidyah (ransom)
She committed a sin and must offer fidyah for wearing prohibited clothing during ihram
She must repeat her entire Hajj because the ihram was invalidated by wearing the niqaab
She is excused only if she removes it immediately upon learning, but still owes compensation

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer explicitly states that there is no sin on someone who does something not allowed during ihram because they were unaware or forgot, and they do not have to offer any fidyah. This is supported by the hadith about the man who wore a jubbah and used saffron while unaware, and Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen's statement that similar to forgetting are cases where one is unaware.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman who wears her hair in braids when performing ghusl because of janaabah (impurity after intercourse)?

options.text: She does not have to undo her braids; it is enough to pour water on her head three times and over the rest of her body
She must undo her braids completely just like when performing ghusl after menstruation or nifaas
She only needs to wipe the surface of her head with water without ensuring it reaches the roots
She is required to undo her braids because the difficulty of redoing them is an insufficient excuse

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith of Umm Salamah clearly states that a woman who wears her hair in braids is excused from undoing them when doing ghusl because of janaabah, due to the difficulty involved in doing them up again. The Prophet said it is enough to pour water on the head three times, then over the rest of the body. However, for ghusl after menstruation or nifaas, she must undo her braids.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on the prayer of someone who was uncertain about the number of prostrations, proceeded on the basis of certainty by doing another prostration, but omitted the prostration of forgetfulness due to ignorance of the ruling?

options.text: His prayer is valid because he was ignorant of the ruling, and he does not have to repeat the prayer
His prayer is invalid and must be repeated because ignorance is not an excuse for omitting obligatory acts
He must repeat the prayer unless he performs the prostration of forgetfulness within a short time of finishing
The prayer is valid only if he performs the missed prostration of forgetfulness before the next prayer time begins

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer explicitly states that the one who is ignorant is like the one who forgot regarding the prostration of forgetfulness. Shaykh Ibn Baz stated that if someone omitted the prostration of forgetfulness because they were ignorant of the ruling or forgot, the prayer is not rendered invalid and is still valid. Only deliberate omission while knowing the ruling invalidates the prayer.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why is masturbation prohibited in Islam according to the scholars?

options.text: The prohibition is based on multiple grounds including the Quranic verse about guarding chastity, preventing desires from dominating, moral grounds, and limiting fulfillment to lawful marriage
It is prohibited solely based on medical findings about physical harm and would change if research proves health benefits
The prohibition is only on moral grounds as being contrary to noble characteristics and human dignity
It is prohibited exclusively because of its addictive nature and the harm to one's health confirmed by physicians

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer emphasizes that the prohibition on masturbation is not based on medical findings alone. The shar'i reason is based on the Quranic verse (al-Mu'minoon 23:5-7) about guarding chastity, preventing desires from dominating beyond halal marriage, protecting reasoning and physical energy, and moral grounds. Medicine is just one of the reasons, not the only reason, which is why the ruling would not change with new medical findings.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman shaving her head?

options.text: It is not permitted except in cases of necessity, such as being unable to care for her hair properly or having a severe lice infestation
It is always prohibited because the Prophet forbade it without mentioning any exceptions in the hadith
It is permissible if done for medical reasons, personal preference, or beautification purposes
It is considered mutilation and forbidden even in cases where she cannot put oil on her hair or care for it

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states that it is not permitted for a woman to shave her head except in cases of necessity, citing the hadith where the Prophet forbade women from shaving their heads. However, Abu Abdullah ruled that if it is a matter of necessity (such as being unable to care for the hair or having a bad lice infestation), there is nothing wrong with doing so.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on sharing your Internet connection with neighbors who may use it for haram purposes like downloading music, movies, or engaging in immoral chats?

options.text: It is not permissible if you think they will most likely use it for haram purposes; you should choose religiously committed neighbors or keep the connection to yourself
It is permissible to share as long as you warn them once about not using it for haram purposes
You share the burden of sin only if you directly witness them using it for prohibited activities
The high cost of the subscription makes it permissible to share even with those who might misuse it to reduce your financial burden

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states that it is not permissible to give an Internet connection to anyone who you think most likely will use it for haram purposes such as downloading images, music, movies, or immoral chats. You should choose neighbors who will never use it for haram purposes, or keep the connection to yourself even if it costs more, to avoid helping anyone in sin.

quizQuestions.questionText: When should a worshipper stand up when the Iqamah is given for prayer?

options.text: The matter is broad in scope and he may stand at the beginning, during, or at the end of the Iqamah, but should not stand until he sees the imam if the imam has not yet entered the mosque
There is a specific Sunnah requiring him to stand exactly when the muezzin says 'hayya 'ala as-salah' (come to prayer)
He must stand at the exact moment the muezzin completes the entire Iqamah according to the majority scholarly view
He should stand immediately at the first 'Allahu Akbar' of the Iqamah regardless of whether he can see the imam

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer explains that scholars differed on when to stand, and there is no clear evidence from the Sunnah to support any specific opinion. The matter is broad in scope, so the worshipper may stand whenever he wants during the Iqamah. However, the Prophet said 'do not stand up until you see me,' meaning if the imam has not entered the mosque when the Iqamah is given, worshippers should not stand until they see him.

quizQuestions.questionText: Is zakah due on photocopying equipment used in a stationery store that also sells products?

options.text: There is no zakah on the equipment because it is for use in the store, not prepared for sale
Zakah is due on the equipment based on the original price for which it was purchased
Zakah must be paid on the equipment because it is part of the store's assets and generates income
The equipment is subject to zakah if its value meets the nisab threshold regardless of whether it is used or sold

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states that there is no zakah on photographic (or photocopying) equipment unless it has been prepared for sale. Shaykh Ibn Baz explained that there is no zakah on items that are for use, whether tools or other things. The basic principle is that zakah is due on whatever is prepared for sale, but tools or equipment used in the store are not subject to zakah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a husband do regarding his wife's Fajr prayer when she is very exhausted from breastfeeding her small daughter during the night?

options.text: He should wake her up and encourage her to pray, though he can delay waking her until it is nearly the end of the time for Fajr prayer
He should let her sleep because exhaustion from breastfeeding is a valid excuse to miss Fajr prayer entirely
Exhaustion from nighttime breastfeeding is a legitimate excuse to delay Fajr prayer until after sunrise
He can let her sleep and she can make up the prayer later since difficult circumstances permit joining Fajr with Dhuhr

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer emphasizes that prayer is very important and must be offered on time, and Fajr cannot be joined with any prayer before or after it. The husband is enjoined to take care of his family and save them from the Fire. He should be keen to wake up his wife and encourage her and help her to pray; he can delay waking her up until it is nearly the end of the time for prayer, but she must pray no matter how tired she is.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on ghabqa (Ramadan supper gatherings) in the Gulf tradition?

options.text: They are permissible as customs but must be free of extravagance, wastefulness, boasting, and wasting nights in leisure
They are prohibited because they involve entertainment, competitions, and traditional songs during Ramadan
They are obligatory communal acts of worship that strengthen brotherhood during Ramadan
They must only be held during the last ten nights of Ramadan to be permissible

quizQuestions.explanation: Ghabqa meals are feasts that fall under customs and traditions, which are in principle permissible according to Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah. However, they must be free of haraam elements like extravagance, wastefulness, boasting, or wasting the nights of Ramadan in leisure and entertainment. The basic principle is that customs are overlooked unless Allah has specifically prohibited something.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on seeking the help of jinn or angels to fly or meet one's needs?

options.text: It is major shirk that puts one beyond the pale of Islam, whether seeking help from jinn or angels
It is permissible to seek help from angels but not from jinn, since angels are righteous beings
It is allowed as long as you believe that only Allah brings ultimate benefit and they are merely means
It is acceptable if done for physical tangible matters like flying, but not for spiritual matters

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the Standing Committee and Ibn Taymiyah, seeking help from jinn or angels to bring benefits or ward off harm is major shirk that puts one beyond the pale of Islam. The Prophet () said: "If you seek help, then seek help from Allah." Physical help can only be sought from living, present, capable humans for tangible matters they control, not from jinn or angels.

quizQuestions.questionText: What must a pilgrim do if he performed tawaaf al-ifaadah by cutting inside the Hijr instead of going around it?

options.text: His tawaaf is invalid and he must return to the Sacred Mosque to perform the complete tawaaf again, going outside the Hijr
He must offer a sacrifice to be slaughtered in Makkah and given to the poor to compensate for the mistake
His tawaaf is valid as long as he went outside the Hijr in most of the seven circuits
He only needs to repeat the specific circuits where he cut inside the Hijr, not the entire tawaaf

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the Standing Committee (Shaykh Ibn Baaz and others), if the invalid tawaaf was tawaaf al-ifaadah (a pillar of Hajj), the Hajj is not valid until the person returns and completes seven proper circuits starting and ending at the Black Stone, with each circuit going outside Hijr Isma'eel. A sacrifice is only required if it was the farewell tawaaf, not tawaaf al-ifaadah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What must a husband do if he stayed away from one wife's house for several nights without valid reason due to anger?

options.text: He must stay overnight with her for the number of nights he missed, then resume the normal rotation between co-wives
He can skip her allocated nights if he genuinely believed she wanted to sleep elsewhere based on what he heard
Forsaking her house is only prohibited if it exceeds one month, based on the Prophet's example with his wives
He only needs to give her extra days if she formally requests compensation before an Islamic judge

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Ibn Qudaamah and the Standing Committee, if a husband stays out during his wife's allocated time, he must make up those nights regardless of his reason for being absent. Ibn Taymiyah clarified that forsaking should only be by refraining from intimacy while still spending the night in her house, not by leaving to stay with another wife. The husband must then return to equitable division after making up the missed nights.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on using credit cards that charge interest if one intends to always pay on time?

options.text: It is prohibited because entering a contract that includes riba is impermissible, and circumstances like forgetting or traveling may cause delays
It is permissible as long as you maintain a consistent record of paying before the interest deadline
It becomes permissible when paying the fixed monthly service fee to the bank for using the card
It is allowed in areas where Islamic banks are unavailable, since necessity permits prohibitions

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen ruled this transaction haraam because entering it involves committing to pay riba if payment is delayed, which is an invalid commitment. Even if someone believes they will pay on time, circumstances may change through forgetting, traveling, or inability to pay. The future is unknown, and approving of or entering a contract that includes riba is not permissible regardless of intentions.

quizQuestions.questionText: Can a new Muslim woman break her fast in Ramadan due to anxiety and insomnia from not being accustomed to fasting?

options.text: She cannot break the fast unless fasting causes significant real hardship, not just mild discomfort or adjustment difficulties
New Muslims are excused from fasting their first Ramadan because the religion is easy and they need gradual adjustment
Psychological anxiety and sleep problems are valid medical excuses that permit breaking the fast
Not fasting due to such reasons is only a minor sin that can be compensated through extra charity

quizQuestions.explanation: An-Nawawi stated that mild sickness not causing real hardship does not permit breaking the fast. The severe warnings against not fasting (including being worse than zina according to adh-Dhahabi) apply when there is no valid excuse. Medicine for anxiety and sleep can be taken at night to maintain the fast. Being a new Muslim or having adjustment difficulties does not override this major obligation and pillar of Islam.

quizQuestions.questionText: Is a marriage contract valid if one witness only signed documents but did not hear the proposal and acceptance?

options.text: The marriage is valid because announcing the marriage publicly is sufficient even without two formal witnesses hearing the contract
The marriage is invalid and must be completely redone with two witnesses physically present to hear everything
Only the written signatures on the official documents matter for validity, not witnessing the spoken words
The marriage is only valid if both witnesses are Islamic scholars or officially appointed marriage officials

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah (as quoted by Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen), announcing the marriage is stronger than merely having it witnessed. A marriage that is announced is valid even without two formal witnesses, while a secret witnessed marriage has some scholarly doubt. Furthermore, everyone present during the contract (scribe, official, relatives) counts as witnesses if they are fit for testimony.

quizQuestions.questionText: Does eating seven dates for protection against witchcraft only benefit those who believe in the hadith?

options.text: It can provide protection even without belief, like ruqyah on a non-believer, but having faith makes the remedy more effective
Only Muslims who have complete certainty and strong faith in the hadith's authenticity receive any protective benefit
The dates provide protection only before witchcraft is cast, not after someone has already been afflicted with sihr
All types of dates provide equal protection as long as seven are eaten, not just ajwah dates from Madinah

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn al-Qayyim cited the story of ruqyah with Surat al-Fatihah on a scorpion sting victim who was a disbeliever or from a mean tribe, showing that Islamic remedies can work even on poor candidates. However, he also explained that faith in the remedy makes one more receptive to healing and increases effectiveness. Most scholars specify ajwah dates from 'Aaliyat al-Madinah, though some like Shaykh Ibn Baaz held it applies to all dates.

quizQuestions.questionText: If someone wipes over the outer layer of two socks then removes it and breaks wudoo, what should he do?

options.text: He may wipe over the lower layer for the remainder of the original wiping period that started when he first wiped
He must perform fresh wudoo completely by washing, as removing the outer layer invalidates the previous wiping
He can start a completely new full wiping period for the lower layer from the time he removed the upper layer
He must always wipe over the uppermost visible layer, so he cannot wipe the lower one after removing the upper

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen citing al-Nawawi and Ibn Surayj, when the outer layer is removed, the layers become like a single khuff with the upper layer visible and lower layer like a lining. Therefore, wiping over the lower layer is permissible for the remainder of the wiping period, calculated from when he first wiped over the upper layer, similar to when the outer surface of a khuff becomes worn or scratched.

quizQuestions.questionText: What conditions must be met when seeking medical treatment for impotence in Islam?

options.text: Treatment must not lead to greater harm or death, must not use haraam substances, must properly cover the awrah, and should involve consulting trustworthy experienced doctors
Treatment is prohibited because it contradicts reliance on Allah's decree and acceptance of His will
Treatment is only permissible using natural herbal remedies and traditional medicine, not modern medical interventions
Treatment is obligatory for married men to fulfill marital rights but remains optional for unmarried men

quizQuestions.explanation: Islam permits treating sickness based on the hadith "Allah does not create any disease but He also creates the cure for it." However, four conditions apply: (1) treatment shouldn't cause greater harm like severe sickness or death, (2) it shouldn't use haraam items like wine or impure substances, (3) it shouldn't involve inappropriate uncovering of the awrah, and (4) it should be done after consulting trustworthy and experienced doctors.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the authentic Du`a to say when breaking the fast according to the hadith from Ibn `Umar?

options.text: "Dhahaba ath-Thama'u, wa abtallat al-'urooq wa thabata al-ajr insha Allah" (Thirst has gone, the veins are moist, and the reward is assured)
"Allahumma laka sumtu wa 'ala rizqika aftartu" (O Allah, for You I have fasted and by Your provision I have broken the fast)
"Ashhadu alla ilaha ill-Allah astaghfir Allah as'aluka al-jannah" (I bear witness that none is worthy of worship but Allah, I ask for Paradise)
No specific Du`a is recommended when breaking the fast according to the Sunnah

quizQuestions.explanation: The authentic hadith narrated by Abu Dawud from Ibn `Umar states that when the Prophet broke his fast, he would say "Dhahaba ath-Thama'u, wa abtallat al-'urooq wa thabata al-ajr insha Allah." This hadith was classed as sound by Al-Albani. The Du`a "Allahumma laka sumtu" comes from an inauthentic hadith, and the other Du`a has no known source.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, what is the most important factor to consider when deciding whether to proceed with a marriage to someone who lives far away?

options.text: His relationship with his Lord and adherence to his religion, especially his commitment to regular prayer and good character
Whether relatives approve of the marriage and interfere to prevent separation
The compatibility in minor matters and ability to reach understanding quickly
The length of time the couple has known each other before engagement

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer emphasizes that the most important matter is the man's relationship with his Lord and adherence to his religion. If he is righteous, prays regularly, and has good character, he will help his family obey Allah. This is especially important if the woman will travel far from her family, as religious commitment prevents mistreatment and injustice.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on leaving excess baggage at the airport when you were entrusted to transport someone's luggage?

options.text: It is considered negligence, and the person becomes liable for those goods and must replace them or pay their value
The person is not liable because there was no prior written agreement specifying responsibility for all items
