Since most of the luggage was delivered successfully, the person fulfilled their duty and is not liable for forgotten items
The person is only liable if they were being paid for the service, not if they were doing it voluntarily

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states that luggage given to transport is a trust (amanah), and the person is not liable unless they transgressed or were negligent. Leaving excess baggage at the airport is specifically described as negligence. Therefore, the person is liable and should have contacted the owner, paid excess baggage fees, or made other arrangements.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, what types of knowledge are included in the hadith about beneficial knowledge that continues after death?

options.text: The hadith is general and includes any beneficial knowledge, with Islamic knowledge being first and foremost, including teaching permissible crafts
Only knowledge of Quran recitation, hadith memorization, and fiqh rulings qualify as beneficial knowledge
Worldly subjects like physics and mathematics never count as beneficial knowledge mentioned in the hadith
Teaching worldly subjects only counts as beneficial knowledge if you charge fees, not if offered for free

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated that what appears to be the case is that the hadith is general in meaning, and for any knowledge that is beneficial, a person will attain reward. He specifically mentioned that if someone teaches a permissible craft or manufacturing and it was beneficial, they will be rewarded, though Islamic knowledge is first and foremost.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Sunnah method for wiping the ears during wudu according to the authentic hadiths?

options.text: Wipe both ears at the same time using index fingers inside and thumbs outside, not starting with the right ear first
Wipe the right ear completely first, then wipe the left ear, following the principle of starting on the right
Wiping the ears is optional during wudu, so any method or order is equally valid
Wipe the left ear first to distinguish it from washing hands and feet where right comes first

quizQuestions.explanation: The authentic hadith in Abu Dawud shows that the Prophet put his index fingers into his ears and wiped the outside with his thumbs, doing both ears simultaneously. An-Nawawi stated that scholars say the ears should be wiped at the same time, not the right ear first. Starting on the right applies only to hands and feet, not ears.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on the hadith from Jubayr ibn Mut'im about reciting specific surahs before traveling?

options.text: It is a weak (da'eef) hadith with unknown narrators in its chain, classed as munkar by Al-Albani
It is authentic according to the conditions of Al-Bukhari and was verified by Al-Haythami
It is weak but still recommended to act upon it as a precautionary measure before traveling
The chain contains only known and trustworthy narrators according to Al-Albani's research

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Haythami said the isnaad includes people who he does not know (unknown narrators), and Shaykh Al-Albani classed it as munkar in As-Silsilah Ad-Da'eefah. Therefore, it is not valid to quote this hadith as evidence for reciting specific surahs before traveling or for saying the basmalah at the beginning of each surah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What determines whether praying in half sleeves or bareheaded is contrary to the command to adorn oneself for prayer?

options.text: It depends on the customs of each country - if the custom considers it proper adornment, it's acceptable; if not, it goes against what Allah enjoined
It is always forbidden to pray bareheaded because men must cover their heads just as women are required to do
Half sleeves are never acceptable for prayer regardless of location since Islam requires full arm coverage
Adornment for prayer means only covering the 'awrah, so anything beyond that is purely optional everywhere

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars explained that while adornment for prayer is commanded and additional to covering 'awrah, this adornment varies by country and customs. If the custom is that best adornment requires covered head or full sleeves, then praying without these goes against Allah's command. But if the custom accepts half sleeves or bare heads as proper adornment, there is nothing wrong with it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the minimum number of rak'ahs for Qiyam al-layl (night prayer)?

options.text: Two rak'ahs, as indicated by authentic hadiths, with no maximum limit
One rak'ah is sufficient according to the authentic hadith from Ibn 'Abbas about voluntary night prayer
Eight rak'ahs is the minimum as unanimously agreed upon by all scholars of fiqh
Since Witr is part of Qiyam and can be one rak'ah, the minimum for Qiyam is also one rak'ah

quizQuestions.explanation: The authentic hadith states "Whoever wakes up at night and wakes his wife, and they pray two rak'ahs together, they will be recorded among the men and women who remember Allah much." The scholars confirmed the minimum is two rak'ahs. Reports suggesting one rak'ah are weak, and Witr is not part of Qiyam al-layl according to the most likely scholarly view.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on participating in lotteries, even if the money raised is for charitable projects?

options.text: Lotteries are another name for gambling and are haram according to Quran, Sunnah and scholarly consensus, even if proceeds go to charity
Lotteries are permissible if all the money collected goes to Islamic charitable projects like helping mujahidin
Occasional participation in lotteries is allowed as long as it doesn't become a regular habit
Lotteries are only haram when they involve intoxicants or idol-worship as mentioned alongside gambling in the Quran

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Baz stated that lotteries and raffles are other names for gambling, which is haram according to the Quran and Sunnah. It is not permissible to engage in gambling even if the money is for charitable projects, because it is evil and forbidden. Shaykh Al-'Uthaymin explained that any transaction where a person may win or lose and doesn't know the outcome is gambling and haram.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why is it not permissible for locals to take Mus-hafs that the state distributes to pilgrims?

options.text: These Mus-hafs are a waqf (endowment) designated specifically for pilgrims, and diverting a waqf from its specified purpose is not permissible
It is permissible if the locals distribute them to people who will use them for Quran teaching and memorization
Locals can take them as long as sufficient quantities remain for the arriving pilgrims
Since they are copies of the Book of Allah, any Muslim can take them regardless of the original intended recipients

quizQuestions.explanation: The Standing Committee explained that these Mus-hafs are a waqf to be distributed in the specified manner (to pilgrims), and it is not permissible to divert the waqf from what has been specified. Taking them defeats the purpose of supplying pilgrims who may not be able to obtain them otherwise. Locals can obtain Mus-hafs from the Department that distributes them to locals.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on someone who speaks words of kufr due to compulsive waswaas (obsessive thoughts) that overwhelm them?

options.text: He is not deemed an apostate if he speaks under pressure of waswaas without intent or awareness, similar to one who is forced
He must renew his Islam and repeat the shahada after each episode of speaking words of kufr caused by waswaas
He is deemed an apostate unless he can prove through medical documentation that he has OCD diagnosed by a specialist
He bears full responsibility for his words unless he immediately seeks treatment from a psychologist and performs ruqya

quizQuestions.explanation: A person suffering from compulsive waswaas who speaks words of kufr under its pressure without awareness or intent is not deemed an apostate, as this is beyond their control. The Quran states that one who is forced to disbelief while their heart is at rest with faith is not a disbeliever (An-Nahl 16:106). The person comes under the same ruling as one forced to speak words of kufr.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on tawarruq involving metals with al-Jazeera Bank as described in the question?

options.text: It is permissible if you personally take possession of the metal and sell it yourself to someone other than the dealer the bank bought from
It is permissible as long as a religious council supervises the transaction, as al-Jazeera Bank has arranged
It is haram according to the Islamic Fiqh Council regardless of whether you sell the metal yourself or delegate the bank
It is permissible only if you use property as guarantee and receive 60-70% of its value in the metal transaction

quizQuestions.explanation: Tawarruq involving metals is permissible only if the customer actually takes possession of the metals and then personally sells them to someone other than the dealer from whom the bank bought them. If the customer delegates the bank to sell, this becomes organized tawarruq which the Islamic Fiqh Council has ruled as haram. Dr. Muhammad al-'Usaymi stated these specific conditions must be met for it to be permissible.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on proceeding with an action when you are unsure whether it is sinful or not, without asking about the ruling first?

options.text: It is not permissible to do something without knowing its ruling; you must learn before acting, and failing to ask due to negligence is a sin
You bear no sin if you proceed without asking, as long as you had the sincere intention to ask about it eventually
You only need to ask if you're certain it might be haram; if you're merely unsure, you may proceed and ask later
Knowledge is required only for obligatory acts like prayer and zakah, not for permissible transactions like buying and selling

quizQuestions.explanation: The Muslim must learn before acting and it is not permissible to proceed with something when they don't know the ruling on it. Allah says: 'And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge' (Al-Isra 17:36). One who fails to ask about what they're uncertain of due to negligence and following desires is being heedless about their religion and deserves punishment, as stated by Ibn al-Qayyim.

quizQuestions.questionText: What must someone do who prayed behind an imam for five years while aware that the imam was an apostate who reviled Allah?

options.text: He must repeat all those prayers, striving to work out how many there were until he is certain he has made up what he owes
His prayers are invalid on the imam's part but valid on his part since he was following in prayer in good faith
He must repeat the prayers only if the signs of the imam's disbelief were obvious and clear to everyone
He must repent sincerely and increase voluntary prayers, but making up the missed prayers is not obligatory

quizQuestions.explanation: Prayers offered behind an apostate imam while aware of his apostasy are invalid and must be repeated. The person must strive to determine how many prayers were offered until they think it most likely they have made up all that was missed. If the number is great but causes hardship, they should keep making them up until certain all have been completed, as stated by Ibn Qudamah in Al-Mughni.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the proper Islamic understanding regarding Allah appointing angels to manage affairs of the universe?

options.text: Submitting to Allah's wisdom without questioning why is fundamental to faith; the angels demonstrate His perfect lordship and instill proper fear and hope in believers
Allah appointed angels to manage affairs because delegation is necessary for the efficient running of the universe's complex systems
Knowing the specific wisdom behind each angel's particular task is a necessary component for complete faith in the angels
The angels were created primarily to highlight the perfect order and systematic design of the universe to increase human understanding

quizQuestions.explanation: The perfect nature of Allah's wisdom is well established, and submitting to it is a fundamental of faith. The basis of servitude is submission without asking about details of wisdom behind commands. The angels demonstrate Allah's perfect lordship and divinity, and belief in them instills proper fear, love and hope. As Ibn Abi'l-'Izz stated, the early generations never questioned why Allah decreed something, as that is contrary to faith and submission.

quizQuestions.questionText: Where should a woman observe her 'iddah when her husband dies after the marriage contract but before consummating the marriage?

options.text: In her family's house where she was living when her husband died, not in the husband's house
In the husband's house that she was going to move to after the marriage was consummated
She may choose between her family's house and the husband's house based on which is more convenient for her
She is not required to observe 'iddah at all since the marriage was never consummated before his death

quizQuestions.explanation: The woman should observe 'iddah in her family's house where she was living when her husband died, because she had not yet moved to the husband's house. Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen was asked this specific question and replied that she should observe 'iddah in her family's house since she had not yet moved to the husband's house. She must observe 'iddah for four months and ten days despite the marriage not being consummated.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the correct Islamic approach to understanding why deeds are shown to Allah daily, weekly, and annually according to the Sunnah?

options.text: We must submit to what is proven in authentic Sunnah without questioning the wisdom; the foundation of faith is acceptance and surrender
The daily showing is for minor deeds, weekly showing for moderate deeds, and annual showing for major deeds requiring deeper review
The repeated showing at different intervals ensures accuracy since recording angels can occasionally make errors in documenting deeds
Each type of showing serves a distinct purpose: daily for warning, weekly for accountability records, and annually for final judgment preparation

quizQuestions.explanation: The showing of deeds daily, weekly and annually is proven in authentic Sunnah, and we must submit without questioning why. The criterion is making the Qur'an and Sunnah our foundation and surrendering to them. As Imam az-Zuhri said: 'Allah sends the message, the Messenger conveys it; our role is to accept and submit.' Questioning divine wisdom after it's been established contradicts faith and leads to confusion and doubts.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on a mother performing the 'aqeeqah for her child when the father is absent or unavailable?

options.text: The 'aqeeqah is Sunnah (not obligatory), primarily the father's duty, but it is mustahabb for the mother if the father refuses or is unable due to distance or being unaware
The 'aqeeqah is obligatory on the father, and the mother may do it only with the father's explicit written permission beforehand
The 'aqeeqah is mustahabb for both parents equally, and either parent may offer it without consulting or informing the other
If the parents are not married, the 'aqeeqah becomes obligatory on the mother since the father has no financial responsibility

quizQuestions.explanation: The 'aqeeqah is Sunnah and mustahabb but not obligatory according to the majority of scholars. The basic principle is that it should be done from the wealth of the father. However, it is permissible and mustahabb for the mother to offer it if the father refuses or is unable to do so because he is far away or unaware of the birth. Allah will record the reward for her in such cases.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith, what is meant by 'he will not get anything of this world except that which has been decreed for him' regarding one focused on worldly gain?

options.text: Caring excessively for worldly gain won't increase provision beyond what's decreed; what's decreed will come but with exertion and hardship unlike for one focused on the hereafter
One whose main concern is the hereafter will receive more provision than what was originally decreed and written for him in Allah's knowledge
One focused only on worldly gain will receive his decreed provision but it will be delayed and he will experience constant fear of poverty
Provision can be increased beyond what's decreed through hard work and effort, regardless of whether one's focus is worldly or spiritual

quizQuestions.explanation: What has been decreed for a person will inevitably come to them regardless. Caring excessively for worldly gain will not increase provision beyond what's been decreed and written. For one who seeks the hereafter, provision comes without undue exertion; for one who seeks worldly gain, it comes with exertion and hardship. As-Sindi explained: both will receive what's decreed, but the one seeking the hereafter achieves both worldly and hereafter gains, while the other loses in both.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on women issuing fatwas and being scholars?

options.text: Islam doesn't differentiate between men and women in issuing fatwas; scholars didn't stipulate the mufti must be male, and many women throughout Islamic history were known as muftis
Women may issue fatwas only to other women and only in matters specifically related to women's jurisprudential affairs
Women may issue fatwas, but there is no difference between being a mufti and being a qaadi (judge) in terms of qualifications
Women's fatwas are considered valid only if they are subsequently reviewed and confirmed by a male scholar according to the majority view

quizQuestions.explanation: Islam does not differentiate between men and women regarding knowledge and issuing fatwas. An-Nawawi listed the conditions for a mufti and did not include being male, stating 'this applies equally to one who is free, a slave, a woman...' Many women in Islamic history were known scholars and muftis, foremost among them 'Aa'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her). However, being a mufti differs from being a qaadi (judge), which women cannot be appointed to.

quizQuestions.questionText: A traveler is fasting on a plane that takes off before sunset. When should they break their fast?

options.text: Continue fasting until the sun sets at their altitude in the plane
Break the fast as soon as a nearby city on the ground has broken their fast
Immediately resume fasting if the sun becomes visible again after takeoff
Request the pilot descend below cloud level so the fast can end sooner

quizQuestions.explanation: If the plane takes off before sunset and the person wants to complete that day's fast while traveling, they should not break their fast until the sun sets in the place where they are in the air. The Standing Committee stated that as long as the fasting person can still see the sun, they cannot break their fast, even if a nearby city has already broken the fast, as the Quranic verse commands to complete the fast until nightfall.

quizQuestions.questionText: Someone has gold that reached nisaab and then acquires new gold during the year. How should zakaah be calculated?

options.text: Start a separate year for the new gold from the day of acquisition, or optionally pay zakaah early by combining it with the old gold's due date
Recalculate the nisaab threshold by adding the new gold's weight to the beginning-of-year amount
Restart the zakaah year for all gold from the date the new gold was acquired
Wait until both the old and new gold have completed their individual years before paying any zakaah

quizQuestions.explanation: When new gold is acquired during the year, a separate year should be started for the newly-acquired gold from the day it came into possession. Zakaah should be given on the old gold when its year passes, then on the new gold when its year passes. Alternatively, if desired, zakaah can be given on all the gold together when the old gold's year passes, which is called giving zakaah in advance.

quizQuestions.questionText: A young man used to take phone cards from his father's store without permission. After repenting, what must he do?

options.text: Estimate the value of the cards taken and return the money to his father without necessarily disclosing what he did
Confess directly to his parents about each card taken to ensure complete transparency
Only perform extra acts of worship without returning the monetary value
Wait until he can calculate the exact amount before making any repayment

quizQuestions.explanation: Valid repentance requires immediately giving up the forbidden action, resolving not to return to it, and restoring people's rightful property. He does not have to tell his father what he did, but he must return the money in whatever way he can. He should try hard to figure out the value of the cards he took without permission and give this money to his father.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on starting a catering business that supplies food for Christian celebrations, weddings, and birthday parties?

options.text: It is prohibited because these celebrations involve haraam elements and helping others with prohibited matters is forbidden
It is permissible as long as the caterer does not personally attend the celebrations
Christian wedding parties are acceptable to cater because they are not haraam in their origins
Only Christmas and New Year catering is prohibited, while birthday parties and other celebrations are acceptable

quizQuestions.explanation: It is haraam to start this business because parties for Christian festivals are haraam to participate in, and Christian wedding parties will never be free of prohibited matters such as free mixing, wanton display, singing, and music. Allah says in the Quran (5:2) not to help one another in sin and transgression. Therefore, it is not allowed to provide services that help facilitate these prohibited celebrations.

quizQuestions.questionText: A young man struggles with controlling himself around women. What should he do to overcome this problem?

options.text: Avoid places of free mixing and temptation entirely, hasten to marry, lower the gaze, and keep righteous company
Continue attending social gatherings but perform extra prayers afterward to expiate for any wrongdoing
Rely solely on repentance and good deeds without changing social habits or environments
Focus only on increasing willpower through fasting without avoiding tempting situations

quizQuestions.explanation: The person must repent sincerely for past misbehavior and do good deeds to expiate for bad deeds. However, he is not permitted at all to go to places where there is corruption and free mixing where he is likely to meet women. He must avoid the places and things that lead to evil and not expose himself to it. He should stick to righteous company, keep away from evil things and people, and do everything that will help him remain chaste, such as hastening to marry and lowering his gaze.

quizQuestions.questionText: A man wants to marry a religious girl who prays and recites adhkaar but does not wear niqaab. What should he do?

options.text: Marry her and educate her about Islamic rulings with patience, as many positive changes can occur after marriage through good treatment and a better environment
Abandon the engagement and search for someone already wearing niqaab to avoid potential future conflicts
Proceed with marriage only after she commits to wearing niqaab before the wedding
Prioritize the approval of both families over Islamic teachings regarding dress code

quizQuestions.explanation: It is better to stay with this girl who has no other faults and who needs only care, encouragement, and sound Islamic education. A lot of positive change may come after marriage, especially if he treats her nicely and moves her into a better environment. There is no reason why a woman who loves her religion and is obedient to her husband should not respond to Allah's command regarding clothing. He should be patient with her and explain the ruling with evidence, using various means such as righteous friends, tapes, and books.

quizQuestions.questionText: Does swearing or using bad language invalidate wudu?

options.text: Swearing does not break wudu, but it is recommended to perform wudu afterward as expiation for the sin
Swearing invalidates wudu and the person must perform it again before praying
Wudu must be repeated only if the swearing occurred during prayer
Backbiting and slander break wudu, but other forms of bad speech do not

quizQuestions.explanation: Swearing is not one of the things that invalidate wudu. However, it is mustahabb (recommended) for one who commits a sin to do wudu, because wudu expiates for sins. Al-Nawawi stated that the correct view is that it is mustahabb to do wudu after saying bad words such as backbiting, lying, or slander for the purpose of expiation, but it is not obligatory. The scholars are unanimously agreed that it is not obligatory to do wudu after saying bad words.

quizQuestions.questionText: If a Muslim woman displays her beauty (tabarruj) to non-mahram men while she has wudu, what is the effect on her wudu?

options.text: The wudu remains valid but the woman has committed a prohibited act by displaying her beauty
Displaying beauty invalidates wudu and requires it to be performed again
The wudu is valid only if the beauty was displayed unintentionally
Wudu becomes invalid only if the adornment is shown to non-mahram men for an extended period

quizQuestions.explanation: What is required of the Muslim woman is to adhere to hijab as prescribed in Islamic teachings and not show her adornment to non-mahram men. However, if a woman displays her beauty and she has wudu, her wudu remains valid and it is not invalidated by that. She has committed a haraam action by displaying her beauty, but this does not affect the validity of her wudu.

quizQuestions.questionText: A Shi'a girl wants to marry but the Bohra group representative is preventing the marriage official from conducting her marriage contract. What is the Islamic ruling?

options.text: If her blood guardians refuse to arrange her marriage, the Muslim judge can perform the marriage contract as the ruler is the guardian for one who has no guardian
The Bohra representative's approval is required for any marriage contract to be valid
She must wait until she turns 25 before she can marry without her guardian's consent
The marriage can only be valid if performed by the Bohra-appointed official

quizQuestions.explanation: Guardians are obliged to arrange marriages if someone compatible proposes. If one of her guardians who is related to her arranges her marriage to a compatible person, the Bohra representative has no right to object and the marriage will be valid. If her relatives refuse to marry her to please the representative, their guardianship becomes invalid, and the Muslim judge (qaadi) has the right to do the marriage contract because the Prophet said: "The ruler is the wali for the one who has no wali."

quizQuestions.questionText: Did Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) see Paradise?

options.text: Yes, he saw Paradise during a solar eclipse prayer and stretched his hand toward its fruits, and also saw it during the Night Journey (Mi'raaj)
He only saw Paradise in dreams, which are symbolic visions rather than actual sightings
He was shown a representation or image of Paradise but did not see the actual Paradise
He described Paradise based on revelation but did not personally witness it

quizQuestions.explanation: Many texts indicate that Paradise and Hell currently exist and that the Prophet saw them. During a solar eclipse, the Prophet prayed and said he saw Paradise and stretched his hand toward a bunch of its fruits. He also saw Hell at that time. Additionally, the Prophet saw Paradise in his dreams (and the dreams of Prophets are revelation and are true), and he saw Paradise on the night of the Mi'raaj when he witnessed the Sidrah covered with what it was covered with.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on the hadith about the Angel of Death asking the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for permission to take his soul?

options.text: The hadith is fabricated (mawdoo') and its isnaad includes 'Abd-Allah ibn Maymoon al-Qaddaah whose reports are worthless
The hadith is sahih and was narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim with sound chains of transmission
The hadith is hasan and acceptable for use in narrating stories about the Prophet's death
The hadith is da'eef (weak) but can be used for virtuous deeds and understanding the circumstances of the Prophet's passing

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith is fabricated (mawdoo'). Al-Haythami stated that its isnaad includes 'Abd-Allah ibn Maymoon al-Qaddaah, whose reports are worthless, and al-Albaani classified it as fabricated. Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen confirmed that the Angel of Death did not come to the Prophet to ask permission, contrary to what this fabricated report claims.

quizQuestions.questionText: How should a widow calculate her 'iddah if her husband died during the middle of a lunar month?

options.text: She observes the remainder of that month plus three full lunar months plus ten days plus what she missed of the first month
She can observe the 'iddah using either the solar or lunar calendar, whichever is more convenient for her circumstances
She must count exactly 130 days from the date of death regardless of the lunar months and their varying lengths
She observes exactly four calendar months of 30 days each plus 10 days, totaling 130 days from the date of death

quizQuestions.explanation: The 'iddah must be observed following the lunar calendar. If the husband died during a month, she observes the remainder of that first month, then three complete lunar months with their new moons (whether 29 or 30 days), plus ten days, then adds whatever she missed of the first month. This is based on Allah's command to observe 'iddah by months as stated in the Quran.

quizQuestions.questionText: A woman was divorced because her husband believed she had leprosy, but doctors confirmed it is not a disease, is not contagious, and can be removed by laser. What is her right regarding the dowry?

options.text: She has the right to the second part of her dowry because what she has is not a deformity and can be removed by laser
She forfeits her right to the second part of the dowry because the husband divorced her due to a medical condition
She only has the right to half of the second part of the dowry because there was initially a medical concern raised
She has no right to any part of the dowry because the divorce was based on the husband's belief that she had a contagious disease

quizQuestions.explanation: So long as it is not a deformity, she has the right to ask for the second part of her dowry. Since doctors confirmed that what she has is not a disease, is not contagious, and can be removed by laser, it is not considered a deformity that would affect her right to the dowry.

quizQuestions.questionText: A Muslim woman's mother wants her to attend a university where boys and girls mix freely, people walk around half naked, drink alcohol, and swear. What is the Islamic ruling?

options.text: It is not permissible for her to study at the university because there is no obedience to any created being if it involves disobedience to the Creator, even if it means disobeying her mother
She should study at the university to obey her mother, then make extra prayers and supplications to protect herself from the corrupt environment
She can attend the university if she wears proper hijab and avoids unnecessary interactions with male students to minimize harm
She should attend the university only for exams and required classes, skipping optional social events to minimize exposure to the corruption

quizQuestions.explanation: If the situation in the university is as described, it is not permissible for her to study there or go there. One of the well-known basic principles of Shari'ah is that there is no obedience to any created being if it involves disobedience to the Creator. She should not obey her mother in this instance, as stated in the Quran: "But if they strive with you to make you join in worship with Me others of which you have no knowledge, then obey them not" [Luqman 31:15].

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling for a sales agent who does not know whether a shopkeeper has already decided to purchase from another company?

options.text: If the sales agent does not know whether the shopkeeper has decided to buy from another company, there is nothing wrong with him offering his products for whatever price he wants
A sales agent is always forbidden from offering lower prices than competitors, as this constitutes underselling one's brother in all circumstances
Sales agents can only offer their products after waiting at least one week from when the shopkeeper made a purchase from a competitor
It is permissible for sales agents to undersell competitors only during public auctions, but not in private business negotiations with shopkeepers

quizQuestions.explanation: If the sales agent does not know anything about whether the shopkeeper has decided to buy from another company  as is usually the case for most sales agents  then there is nothing wrong with him offering his products for whatever price he wants, and there is no sin in that. However, if he knows that the shopkeeper has decided to buy from another company, then it is not permissible for him to offer his goods to him in that case.

quizQuestions.questionText: What evidence indicates that the Prophet's instruction to bring writing materials during his illness was not revelation he was obligated to convey?

options.text: The incident occurred on Thursday and the Prophet died on Monday four days later, and he could have asked others to write the document but did not, indicating it was not obligatory revelation
The Prophet wanted to write instructions appointing 'Ali as caliph, but 'Umar prevented this to ensure Abu Bakr would become the successor instead
'Umar disobeyed a direct command from the Prophet by refusing to bring writing materials, which the Prophet rebuked him for severely afterwards
The document would have contained new Islamic rulings that the ummah needed, but were lost forever due to the companions' refusal to bring materials

quizQuestions.explanation: This incident happened on a Thursday, and the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died on the following Monday, four days later. He could have asked others to write that document, but because he did not do that, we know that it was not revelation that he could have concealed. If it had been obligatory revelation, the Prophet would not have failed to convey what Allah instructed him to do, as confirmed by Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What was the view of Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah regarding cheese made by Magians (Zoroastrians) with rennet from animals that died of natural causes?

options.text: The cheese of the Magians is halal and the rennet and milk of an animal that died of natural causes are taahir (pure), based on the practice of the Sahaabah who ate such cheese when they conquered Iraq
All scholars unanimously agree that cheese made with rennet from animals that died of natural causes is najis (impure) and completely forbidden to eat
The cheese of Magians is only permissible if the Muslims can verify that the animal was slaughtered according to Islamic guidelines before using its rennet
Eating cheese from Magians is permissible only in cases of extreme necessity when no other halal food sources are available to Muslims

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah said in his Fatawa that what is more likely to be the case is that the cheese of the Magians is halal and that the rennet and milk of an animal that died of natural causes are taahir (pure). This is because when the Sahaabah conquered Iraq, they ate the cheese of the Magians, and this was the prevalent practice among them.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on the father seeing his son's fiance before and after the marriage contract?

options.text: It is not permissible for the father to see his son's fiance before the marriage contract because she is a non-mahram to him, but after the marriage contract she becomes a mahram to him even if the marriage has not been consummated
The father may see the fiance together with his son present, as long as he maintains modest behavior and does not look directly at her face
The father can see the fiance only after the marriage has been consummated and she has moved into the family home with the family
It is permissible for the father to briefly meet the fiance during the engagement ceremony to confirm his approval, but not to look at her closely

quizQuestions.explanation: It is not permissible for the father to see his son's fiance because she is a non-mahram to him, and no exception has been narrated with regard to the man's father. However, when his son does the marriage contract with his fiance, she becomes his wife (even if he has not consummated the marriage with her), and she becomes a mahram to the father, as Allah says: "Forbidden to you (for marriage) are... the wives of your sons who (spring) from your own loins" [an-Nisa' 4:23].

quizQuestions.questionText: How should brownish discharge be regarded in relation to a woman's menstrual period and purity?

options.text: If the brownish discharge comes before the woman sees the white discharge that indicates purity, it is part of the period, but if it comes after she sees the white discharge, it does not affect her praying or fasting
Any brownish discharge is always considered part of the menstrual period regardless of when it occurs, and the woman must refrain from prayer and fasting until it stops completely
Brownish discharge after the sixth day of menstruation is never considered part of the period and the woman should resume prayers immediately upon seeing it
The woman should wait three full days after any brownish discharge stops before resuming prayers and fasting to ensure she is completely pure

quizQuestions.explanation: If the brownish discharge comes before the woman sees that she is pure (the white discharge), then it is part of the period. If it comes after she sees that she is pure, then it is not part of the period and does not affect her praying and fasting. This is based on the statement of Umm 'Atiyyah: "We used not to regard the brownish or yellowish discharge that comes after a woman becomes pure as being anything that mattered," and 'Aa'ishah would tell women: "Do not hasten until you see the white discharge."

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on Muslims taking help from churches and what conditions apply?

options.text: There is nothing wrong with taking help from churches so long as it does not lead to compromising religion or children being influenced, but refraining from it is preferable because the upper hand that gives is better than the lower hand that takes
It is completely forbidden to take any help from churches under all circumstances because they are non-Muslim organizations with ulterior motives toward Muslims
Muslims can freely take help from churches and state organizations without any conditions, as this is considered their right as residents of the country
Taking help from churches is only permissible during Ramadan or other Islamic occasions when the need for food and resources is greater than usual

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing wrong with taking help from the state or from organizations based on donations, even if they are churches, so long as that does not lead to compromising on any issue of religion or approving anything wrong or the children being influenced. However, refraining from that and doing without it is preferable, because the upper hand (the one that gives) is better than the lower (the one that takes), as stated by the Prophet, especially with regard to taking from the church which usually has ulterior motives in what it gives to the Muslims.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the status of the hadith: 'When Adam committed his sin, he asked Allah by virtue of Muhammad to forgive him, and Allah said: Were it not for Muhammad, I would not have created you'?

options.text: The hadith's chain includes 'Abd al-Rahman ibn Zayd ibn Aslam, who is da'eef (weak) by consensus and makes many mistakes, and al-Albani ruled it fabricated
The hadith was authenticated by al-Bayhaqi in Dalail al-Nubuwwah and has a sound chain of transmission
Ibn Taymiyah confirmed the hadith's authenticity in al-Tawassul and recommended using it in religious exhortation
The hadith has multiple reliable chains through different Companions including 'Umar ibn al-Khattab with strong narrators

quizQuestions.explanation: This hadith is fabricated according to Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah, al-Bayhaqi, and al-Albani. Its chain includes 'Abd al-Rahman ibn Zayd ibn Aslam, who is weak by consensus and makes many mistakes. Al-Albani ruled it fabricated in al-Silsilah al-Da'eefah (25).

quizQuestions.questionText: For a woman who has a problem which means her wudoo' is broken constantly, when does her wudoo' remain valid for the following obligatory prayer?

options.text: If nothing comes out between prayers, the first wudoo' remains valid and she may pray the following obligatory prayer
The wudoo' automatically becomes invalid at the end of each prayer time regardless of whether anything comes out
She must perform wudoo' before every single act of worship including saa'i because purity is essential for all Hajj rituals
According to all scholars without exception, tawaaf performed without wudoo' is completely invalid and must be repeated

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the majority of fuqaha', if nothing comes out, the wudoo' remains valid and the person may offer the following obligatory prayer. Al-Bahooti and Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen both stated that wudoo' is only required if something has come out.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the status of the report that Moosa (peace be upon him) said 'O Lord, protect me from people's tongues,' and Allah replied: 'O Moosa, I did not grant that to Myself so how could I grant it to you'?

options.text: This report could not be found with any reliable isnad and appears only in books of raqaiq and exhortation without mentioning any chain of transmission
This report has a sahih chain narrated by both al-Bukhari and Muslim in their authentic collections
Ibn Muflih al-Maqdisi authenticated this report with a strong isnad in al-Adab al-Shar'iyyah
The report was narrated with multiple reliable chains by the major hadith scholars and is widely accepted

quizQuestions.explanation: We could not find this report with any reliable isnad, and it was not found in the books of Sunnah and reports. Rather, it was seen in some books of raqaiq and exhortation without mentioning any isnad or reliable source.

quizQuestions.questionText: What was Imam Ahmad's position on initiating Eid greetings such as 'Taqabbal Allahu minna wa minkum'?

options.text: He said: 'I do not initiate this greeting with anyone, but if someone greets me in this manner I return his greeting,' because returning a greeting is obligatory
He ruled that offering Eid greetings is a forbidden innovation that has no basis in the Sunnah
He stated that only the specific phrase 'Taqabbal Allahu minna wa minkum' is permissible and all other greetings are forbidden
He considered it obligatory to initiate Eid greetings because the Companions always did so on the day of Eid

quizQuestions.explanation: Imam Ahmad said: 'I do not initiate this greeting with anyone. But if someone greets me in this manner I return his greeting.' Ibn Taymiyah explained that returning a greeting is obligatory, but initiating this greeting is not a Sunnah that is enjoined, but neither is it forbidden.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the position of the majority of the four madhhabs regarding the number of khutbahs on Eid?

options.text: Two khutbahs should be given with the imam sitting briefly between them, by analogy with the Jumu'ah khutbah
Only one khutbah should be given based on unanimous agreement of all four madhhabs from the authentic ahadith
The Eid khutbah must be delivered before the prayer, unlike the Jumu'ah khutbah which comes after
Three khutbahs should be given: one for men, one for women, and one general khutbah

quizQuestions.explanation: The majority of scholars of the four madhhabs hold that two khutbahs should be given on Eid, with the imam sitting briefly between them, following the pattern of Jumu'ah. This is supported by analogy with Jumu'ah and the report of 'Ubayd-Allah ibn 'Abd-Allah ibn 'Utbah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Shaykh Ibn Baaz say about the hadith 'Women have no share of the funeral'?

options.text: He said: 'We do not know of any basis for it, and we do not know any of the scholars who narrated it'
He authenticated this hadith and used it as evidence that women are prohibited from all funeral-related activities
He confirmed that this hadith permits women to follow the funeral procession to the graveyard and visit graves
He stated that this hadith applies equally to prohibit women from attending funeral prayers in mosques, homes, and prayer places

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Baaz said regarding the hadith 'Women have no share of the funeral': 'We do not know of any basis for it, and we do not know any of the scholars who narrated it.' He explained that women are permitted to offer the funeral prayer in the mosque and attended such prayers with the Prophet.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Salih Al-Fawzan, what is the ruling on using breath spray while fasting?

options.text: If the spray is used and none of it reaches the throat, there is nothing wrong with it, but one should spit out or rinse whatever remains in the mouth
The smell from the mouth of a fasting person should be removed immediately as it is disliked in Islam
All types of mouth sprays invalidate the fast regardless of whether they reach the throat or not
The Prophet forbade using any fragrance for the mouth during fasting because it removes the blessed smell of fasting

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Al-Fawzan stated: 'If the spray is used and none of it reaches the throat, there is nothing wrong with it.' He also noted that the smell from the mouth of the fasting person is beloved by Allah and the hadith says it is 'better before Allah than the fragrance of musk.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Shaykh al-Fawzan say about dividing the night prayers into Taraweeh and qiyaam during the last ten days of Ramadan?

options.text: All of it may be called Taraweeh or qiyaam - the distinction is merely a variation in naming, not in the nature of the prayer itself
Salat al-ta'qeeb refers to any voluntary prayer offered in congregation before Witr during Ramadan
Taraweeh must be prayed immediately after 'Isha' according to scholarly consensus and cannot be delayed to the end of the night
The practice of dividing prayers in the last ten days contradicts the Sunnah because the Prophet only prayed at the beginning of the night

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh al-Fawzan stated: 'This is a variation in naming only. In fact all of it may be called Taraweeh or it may be called qiyaam.' He explained that breaking up the prayers during the last ten days combines different scholarly opinions and is permissible.

quizQuestions.questionText: A man dies leaving behind nieces (daughters of his deceased brother), nephews and nieces (children of his deceased sisters), and a paternal cousin. How is his estate divided?

options.text: The entire estate goes to the paternal cousin because he is the closest male relative (asib) and the only one entitled to inherit
The daughters of the deceased's brother inherit equal shares with the paternal cousin according to the rules of kalalah
The sons and daughters of the deceased's sisters receive the allocated shares while the paternal cousin receives only the remainder
The dhawi'l-arham (distant relatives) inherit in this case because there are no heirs entitled to allocated shares in the estate

quizQuestions.explanation: The entire estate goes to the paternal cousin as he is the only 'asib (male relative on the father's side). The Prophet said: 'Give the allocated shares to those entitled, and whatever is left over goes to the closest male relative.' The nieces and nephews are dhawi'l-arham who do not inherit when there is a male relative on the father's side.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on keeping a riba-based certificate while paying off your father's riba-based loan, if the certificate was taken in pledge for the loan?

options.text: If you are unable to cancel the certificate because it was taken in pledge for the loan, there is no blame on you and you can continue paying your father's debt
You must cancel the certificate immediately even if it is in pledge for the loan, because paying your father's debt is obligatory according to Islamic teachings
Keeping a riba-based certificate is permissible as long as you only take the original amount mentioned in it and not the interest
The investment certificates issued by banks in your country are halal and permissible because they are regulated by Islamic banking principles

quizQuestions.explanation: If you are not able to cancel the riba-based certificate because it was taken in pledge for the loan, there is no blame on you and you can carry on paying your father's debt. However, if you are able to cancel it, you must do so even if it means not paying your father's debt, as you are not obliged to pay it according to Islamic teachings.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the proper way to erase forbidden images according to Islamic rulings?

options.text: The facial features must be erased to make the image disappear
Only the eyes need to be erased from the image
The entire body must be erased, not just the face
Any part of the image can be erased as long as something is removed

quizQuestions.explanation: The image is the face, which must be erased so that the image disappears. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade striking the 'image,' and other ahadith clarified this means the face. Therefore, the facial features must be erased to properly remove a forbidden image.

quizQuestions.questionText: A wife's husband spends most of his time outside watching football, leaving her alone all day. What should she do according to Islamic guidance?

options.text: She should not bring a TV due to its obvious bad effects, and instead find ways to make her husband want to stay home through kind treatment and common interests
She should buy a TV so her husband stays home with her
She should allow her husband to keep watching football outside since it may be permissible
She should spend her free time watching TV herself since she is alone all day

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer advises against bringing a TV into the home because of its obvious bad effects. Instead, the wise wife should look for ways to make her husband want to stay home, such as treating him well, taking care of him, adorning herself, and looking for common interests. She should also make good use of her time in things that benefit her, such as memorizing Quran and attending halaqahs.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on using sleeping pills and relaxants to treat anxiety and insomnia?

options.text: It is not permissible to use sleeping pills and relaxants except on the advice of a trustworthy doctor
Self-medication with relaxants is permissible as long as they are available without prescription
Using such medications will stop prayer from being accepted for 40 days
Muscle relaxants are permissible to use regularly since they help with sleep and calmness

quizQuestions.explanation: It is not permissible to use sleeping pills and relaxants except on the advice of a trustworthy doctor, because some of them can contain narcotics, some can cause addiction, and some do more harm than good. Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated it is not permissible to use these pills except in cases of necessity, on condition that they be recommended by a knowledgeable doctor, as they are dangerous and have an impact on brain function.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should you do when someone sneezes but does not say 'al-hamdu lillah' (praise be to Allah)?

options.text: It is not prescribed to say 'Yarhamuk Allah' to him, nor to remind him to praise Allah
You should remind him to say 'al-hamdu lillah' before responding with 'Yarhamuk Allah'
You should say 'Yarhamuk Allah' even if he didn't praise Allah, then remind him afterward
The Prophet would always remind those who sneezed but forgot to praise Allah

quizQuestions.explanation: If someone sneezes and does not praise Allah, it is not prescribed to say 'Yarhamuk Allah' to him or to remind him to praise Allah. This is based on the authentic hadith where the Prophet said 'Yarhamuk Allah' to one of two men who sneezed but not to the other, explaining that one praised Allah and the other did not. If reminding was prescribed, the Prophet would have reminded the man who didn't praise Allah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on reciting the beginning and end of Soorat al-Baqarah at the grave after burying the deceased?

options.text: The hadith about reciting the beginning and end of Soorat al-Baqarah at the grave is very weak (da'eef jiddan) and not to be practiced
This practice is confirmed as sunnah from the Prophet and should be done at every burial
The saheeh practice is to recite al-Faatihah and the beginning and end of Soorat al-Baqarah at the head of the grave
Ibn Hibbaan's authentication of the narrator makes this hadith reliable for practice

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith about reciting the beginning and end of Soorat al-Baqarah at the grave is very weak (da'eef jiddan) according to al-Albaani. The isnad includes unknown narrators like 'Abd ar-Rahmaan ibn al-'Alaa' ibn al-Lajlaaj. The saheeh report from Ibn 'Umar is about saying 'Bismillah wa billah wa 'ala millati Rasoolillah' when the deceased is placed in the grave.

quizQuestions.questionText: What testimony is required from the four witnesses to establish the crime of zina (adultery/fornication)?

options.text: The four witnesses must testify that they saw the man's penis in the woman's vagina in clear terms
Witnesses seeing the man and woman naked together or in compromising positions is sufficient to establish zina
High dowries and expensive weddings help protect society from the spread of zina and immorality
The hadd punishment for zina was commonly applied through witness testimony throughout Islamic history

quizQuestions.explanation: The four witnesses to zina must describe it in clear terms, such as saying 'I saw his penis in her vagina.' There is no alternative to that explicit testimony. If they only say they saw them naked or in certain positions, that is not sufficient. Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen mentioned that no case of zina was proven by testimony from the Prophet's time until the time of Ibn Taymiyah because it is very difficult to meet this strict requirement.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on playing cards without gambling?

options.text: Playing cards is prohibited even without gambling because it wastes time, resembles dice playing, includes pictures of souls (Jack and Queen), and promotes cheating and deception
Playing cards is permissible as long as there is no gambling or betting involved
Cards are only prohibited if they cause you to miss prayer times
The Jack and Queen pictures can be removed from the deck to make card-playing permissible

quizQuestions.explanation: Playing cards is prohibited for multiple reasons: (1) wasting time with no benefit, (2) based on gambling and resembles dice which is clearly prohibited, (3) includes pictures of creations with souls (Jack and Queen), (4) causes rancor and enmity between players, (5) promotes cheating and deception, and (6) distracts from worship of Allah. The Prophet said whoever plays with dice resembles one who has tainted his hand with the flesh and blood of a pig.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on religiously committed women having boyfriends with whom they engage in intimacy like hugging and kissing, intending to marry them later?

options.text: Having a boyfriend with intimacy like hugging and kissing is haraam and abhorrent, not excused by emotional attachment or intention to marry
Their worship and prayers are still accepted since they regret their actions and plan to marry these men
This relationship is permissible since they have not committed fornication and intend to marry in the future
Their knowledge of Islamic rulings excuses them from the sin since they are religiously committed and aware it is wrong

quizQuestions.explanation: Having boyfriends with intimacy is haraam and abhorrent. Allah describes chaste believing women as those who avoid 'taking boyfriends.' The excuse of emotional attachment is the essence of following whims and desires which lead to doom. The one who knows bears greater responsibility, and going against knowledge is worse and more reprehensible. Knowledge alone does not prevent sin, as shown by the example of Iblees and the Jews who knew the truth but rejected it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What does Islam teach about women's capabilities compared to men in terms of leadership, scholarship, and achievement?

options.text: Individual women may be superior to some men, but this is rare when comparing men and women as a whole across leadership positions, inventions, and scholarship throughout history
Women are generally more active and superior to men in most fields of work and leadership roles
Secular societies provide better rights and protection for women than Islamic societies do
Jihad is not applicable in this modern age and was only prescribed for the early Islamic period

quizQuestions.explanation: While some women may be superior to some men, this is rare overall. Looking at all nations, the vast majority of presidents, prime ministers, ministers, CEOs, inventors, explorers, and scholars throughout human history have been men, confirming men's general superiority in these roles. Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen stated that saying 'men are better than women' doesn't mean each individual man is superior to each individual woman, but that the category in general is superior, though individual women may be superior to some men.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on describing someone as boring when speaking about them in their absence?

options.text: Describing someone as boring in his absence is backbiting (gheebah), even if said in anger, and requires repentance
Criticizing someone in his presence is backbiting, while criticizing in his absence is reviling
Speaking ill of someone in anger is not considered backbiting since it was said in an emotional moment
Backbiting only applies if what you say is untrue; if it's true then it's permissible to say

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet defined backbiting as saying about your brother in his absence something that he dislikes, even if it is true. If it's untrue, then it's a grave lie. Saying someone is boring in his absence constitutes backbiting even if said in anger, because anger does not make it permissible. Backbiting refers to speaking ill in absence; criticizing in presence is insulting/reviling which is also haraam. One should repent and apologize if the person heard, or seek forgiveness and pray for him if he didn't.

quizQuestions.questionText: A woman gave birth and experienced intermittent bleeding with yellowish discharge. Ten days after childbirth, she begins fasting in Ramadan while still experiencing light bleeding and mucus without complete dryness. What is the ruling on her fasts?

options.text: Her fasts are invalid because yellowish discharge or mucus without complete dryness still counts as nifaas
Her fasts are valid since nifaas has a maximum limit of ten days and she has passed that period
Her fasts are valid if the bleeding is very light, even without seeing complete dryness or white discharge
Her fasts are valid after seeing the white discharge, even if yellowish mucus continues afterward

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, yellowish discharge or mucus without clear signs of purity (complete dryness or white discharge) still comes under the same rulings as nifaas blood. The woman is not pure until this ends completely. The maximum limit of nifaas is forty days, not ten, and fasting is not valid while in nifaas.

quizQuestions.questionText: A charitable foundation holds Quran memorization competitions and wants to give cash prizes from zakah funds to the winners. What is the Islamic ruling on this practice?

options.text: Prizes can be given from zakah funds only if the winner is among the eight categories entitled to receive zakah
Zakah prizes are permissible for all Muslims who win Quran competitions regardless of their financial status
Zakah funds can be used for such prizes because they encourage memorization of Quran and Islamic knowledge
Non-Muslim winners can receive zakah prizes if they show genuine interest in learning about Islam

quizQuestions.explanation: Zakah can only be spent on the eight categories mentioned in Quran 9:60. Shaykh Ibn Jibreen stated that zakah may be given to poor Muslims even if given as prizes, but if the winner is not one of those entitled to zakah, it is not permissible. These competitions should be financed through donations and waqfs, not zakah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What was the belief of pre-Islamic Arabs regarding Allah and their idol worship before Prophet Muhammad was sent?

options.text: They acknowledged Allah as the Creator and Provider but worshipped idols as intermediaries to bring them closer to Allah
They were completely unaware of the concept of Allah until Prophet Muhammad introduced monotheism to them
They believed the idols themselves were the actual creators and providers who controlled the universe
They worshipped Allah alone without any partners but rejected the concept of prophethood and messengers

quizQuestions.explanation: The Quran confirms in verses 31:25 and 39:38 that pre-Islamic Arabs acknowledged Allah as the Creator of heavens and earth. Their problem was shirk in worship (uloohiyyah), not denying Allah's existence. They worshipped idols not as creators, but as intermediaries, saying 'We worship them only that they may bring us near to Allah' (39:3).

quizQuestions.questionText: A family's sacrificial animal fell from the roof on the day of Eid after the prayer. They managed to slaughter it properly before it died. What is the ruling on this sacrifice?

options.text: The sacrifice is valid if slaughtered at the proper time before the animal died, even though it was damaged from the fall
The sacrifice is invalid because the animal was damaged by falling, making it unsuitable as an udhiyah
A new sacrifice must be offered because the animal died from a headlong fall which is forbidden
The sacrifice is only valid if it was slaughtered before any injury or damage occurred to the animal

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clarifies that if the animal was slaughtered during the days of sacrifice (Eid day and three following days) and they managed to slaughter it before it died, it is valid. Quran 5:3 forbids animals killed by headlong fall 'unless you are able to slaughter it (before its death),' which means catching it and slaughtering properly while there is still life in it.

quizQuestions.questionText: A group of friends joked about punishments in Hell months ago. They have since performed Umrah and continue their regular prayers, unaware that such jokes constitute disbelief. What must they do?

options.text: They must renew their faith by uttering the Shahadatayn and repent specifically from the apostasy of mocking Islam
Their Umrah and subsequent prayers automatically renewed their faith, so no specific action is needed now
Only the person who initiated the joke needs to repent; those who merely laughed are not affected
They should continue their worship sincerely and Allah will forgive them without explicitly renewing the Shahadah

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymin, whoever speaks words of disbelief even in jest has disbelieved and must repent, believing they are repenting from apostasy. While uttering the Shahadah during Umrah or prayer is sufficient for renewal, they must repent sincerely and specifically from this grave evil. Quran 9:65-66 explicitly states that mocking Allah's revelations constitutes disbelief.

quizQuestions.questionText: A Muslim man committed zina with a married woman who had left her abusive husband. The woman has now received her divorce papers and completed her iddah. Both have repented. Can they marry?

options.text: Marriage is valid if he did not turn her against her husband and they both sincerely repented from the zina
The marriage is automatically invalid because zina occurred with a married woman, regardless of subsequent repentance
They can marry immediately after her divorce without waiting for iddah since zina already occurred between them
Separation from her husband for one year constituted automatic divorce, so the zina was with an unmarried woman

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states that if the man did not turn the woman against her husband (which would invalidate marriage per Ibn Taymiyyah and Malikis), and only met her after she had already left, the marriage is valid after sincere repentance. Most scholars allow marriage of zaani to zaaniyah after repentance. Separation alone does not cause divorce; actual divorce must occur, and iddah must be completed.

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the conditions required for the Shahadah (La ilaha ill-Allah) to be accepted and lead to Paradise?

options.text: Knowledge of its meaning, certainty without doubt, acceptance with the heart, submission to its implications, truthfulness, sincerity, and love for Allah
Reciting it five times daily during prayers, teaching it to family members, and sharing it with the Muslim community
Memorizing all ninety-nine names of Allah, performing all five daily prayers punctually, and making regular supplications
Believing in Allah's existence, avoiding all major sins consistently, and attending Friday congregational prayers

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars identified seven main conditions: (1) Knowledge of the Shahadah's meaning, (2) Certainty as opposed to doubt, (3) Acceptance with heart and words, (4) Submission to what it implies, (5) Truthfulness from the heart, (6) Sincerity free from shirk, and (7) Love for this word and its people. Some scholars add an eighth: rejection of false gods (al-kufr bi'l-taghut).

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on organizing and attending festivals that feature singers, music, actors and poets for most of the event?

options.text: It is haraam to organize or attend such festivals as they waste wealth in sinful activities and spread immorality among believers
Such festivals are permissible if they include some Islamic poetry and Quranic recitation alongside the music and singing
Attending is permissible as long as one maintains good intention and does not personally participate in singing or dancing
Organizing is allowed if the performers are Muslim and the songs contain no explicitly haraam or immoral content

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states it is haraam to organize parties with haraam elements like singing and music, as they are causes of falling into immorality. Quran 24:19 warns about spreading immorality among believers. It is also haraam to attend as this wastes time and money in things not pleasing to Allah and constitutes cooperating in sin, which contradicts Quran 5:2.

quizQuestions.questionText: During Tarawih prayers with lengthy recitation, a worshipper sits between sets to rest. Can he say the opening takbir while sitting, then stand up during the recitation when he feels energetic?

options.text: He can say the opening takbir while sitting and stand when energetic, but will receive half the reward of praying standing throughout
He must say the opening takbir while standing or the entire rak'ah will be invalid
Sitting during any part of Tarawih prayer invalidates that rak'ah and it must be repeated
The reward is the same whether sitting or standing since Tarawih is a voluntary prayer

quizQuestions.explanation: It is permissible to sit in nafl prayers with no excuse according to scholarly consensus, but the reward is half that of praying standing (as stated in hadith in Muslim 1214). One may say the opening takbir sitting then stand later in the same rak'ah, as the Prophet would recite sitting when tired, then stand to bow. This applies when able to stand; if unable, the full reward is maintained.

quizQuestions.questionText: A person joined the prayer late. The imam made a mistake after the latecomer joined and performed the prostration of forgetfulness before the salaam. What should the latecomer do?

options.text: He must follow the imam in prostration, then prostrate again after completing his own missed rak'ahs and giving salaam
He should not repeat the prostration of forgetfulness since following the imam once in prostration is sufficient
He should wait and prostrate with the imam after the salaam if the mistake happened while he was in the prayer
He only needs to prostrate if the imam's mistake occurred specifically in the rak'ah that he joined

quizQuestions.explanation: When the imam prostrates before salaam for a mistake that occurred after the latecomer joined, the latecomer must follow him because he is connected to his imam. However, he must prostrate again after completing his prayer, because his first prostration with the imam was not at the right point in his own prayer (it was only done in following the imam). If the mistake occurred before he joined, he doesn't repeat it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a man who said zihaar and divorced a woman three times before the marriage contract was done with her?

options.text: He does not need to offer any expiation because the marriage contract had not been done, but if he intended to refrain from intercourse with her, he should offer expiation for breaking an oath if he marries her
He must offer expiation for zihaar by freeing a slave or fasting for two consecutive months before he can marry her
The threefold divorce is valid and binding, so he must remarry her with a new marriage contract and two witnesses
He must wait for a four-month waiting period before he can marry her, as prescribed for those who make zihaar

quizQuestions.explanation: Zihaar and divorce uttered before the marriage contract do not count, because divorce can only happen after marriage (Al-Ahzaab 33:49), and zihaar applies only to wives (Al-Mujaadilah 58:3). However, if he intended by zihaar to refrain from intercourse, he should offer expiation for breaking an oath if he marries and has intercourse with her, to be on the safe side.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the best time to hold the wedding feast (Walimah) according to Islamic teachings?

options.text: It is best after the marriage is consummated following the Prophet's example, but permissible at the time of marriage contract or before consummation, with no set number of guests
It must be done exactly when the marriage contract is done, and the minimum number of guests is forty men to properly announce the marriage
It must be held within three days after the marriage contract, and inviting fewer than ten people invalidates the Walimah
It is only valid if done before the marriage is consummated, and the groom must personally invite each guest to fulfill the Sunnah

quizQuestions.explanation: The best time for Walimah is after consummation, following the Prophet's example with Zaynab bint Jahsh (when day dawned, he was a bridegroom and invited people). However, the matter is flexible and may be done from the time of contract until after consummation, with no set number of guests (depends on one's means).
quizQuestions.source: Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and various scholars including Ibn Hajar and Shaykh Al-Fawzan

quizQuestions.questionText: If someone misses Tarawih prayer for some nights of Ramadan, can they still attain the virtue mentioned in the Hadith about forgiveness of previous sins?

options.text: The Hadith refers to standing in prayer for the entire month, but those who miss nights due to illness or travel may still attain the virtue, while missing out of laziness means not achieving it
You must pray all nights in congregation at the mosque to receive forgiveness; praying at home or missing even one night nullifies the entire reward
Missing three or more nights for any reason requires making up those prayers before Eid, otherwise the forgiveness is not granted
The Hadith only applies to those who pray the full twenty Rak`ahs each night; praying eleven or thirteen Rak`ahs does not fulfill the condition

quizQuestions.explanation: The Hadith encompasses the whole month of Ramadan. Those who miss nights due to valid excuses (illness, travel) are hoped to attain the virtue, as deeds are written as if performed during illness/travel. However, missing nights out of laziness means not achieving the mentioned virtue according to the apparent meaning of the Hadith.
quizQuestions.source: Al-Bukhari, Muslim, As-San`ani, Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin

quizQuestions.questionText: Where is the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) mentioned in the Bible according to Islamic sources?

options.text: He is mentioned in Deuteronomy 18:18-19 as a prophet 'from among their brothers' (sons of Ishmael), and in John 16 as the Counselor who will guide into all truth
His name appears exactly seven times in the original Hebrew Torah, but all instances were removed during the Council of Nicea in 325 CE
He is mentioned only symbolically through numerical codes in Genesis, which can be decoded using the Hebrew gematria system
The only reference is in the Book of Revelation where he is described as the rider on a white horse who will come in the seventh century

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet is mentioned in Deuteronomy 18:18-19 ('from among their brothers' refers to sons of Ishmael, not Israel) and in John 16:6-8, 12-13 as the Counselor/Paraclete who will guide into all truth and speak what he hears. He is also referenced in Deuteronomy 33:2 where 'Paran' refers to Makkah.
quizQuestions.source: Quran (Al-Saff 61:6, Al-A'raaf 7:157), Ibn al-Qayyim, various Biblical texts

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a father do if he travels far from his children for long periods and notices their behavior becoming bad?

options.text: If his travel will cause his children to go astray, he should return to them and focus on their upbringing, because the first responsibility is their religious commitment, not just earning money
He must continue traveling to provide wealth, as the Prophet said 'the best of you is the one who earns the most for his family', even if it affects the children's behavior
He can continue traveling as long as he sends money regularly and calls them weekly, because financial provision fulfills his obligation as shepherd of the family
He should travel for six months per year maximum, as this is the limit set by Islamic scholars for maintaining family bonds while earning income

quizQuestions.explanation: The father's first responsibility is his children's religious commitment and morals, not just earning money. The Prophet said 'It is sufficient sin for a man that he should neglect those who are dependent on him.' Ibn Taymiyah stated that if travel causes harm to the family, the person should not travel.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on whether a person who performs Umrah on behalf of someone else receives the same reward?

options.text: There are two scholarly views: one says the proxy receives reward like the deceased, the other says only the deceased receives the Hajj reward while the proxy gets reward for kindness
The proxy receives exactly half the reward of the person on whose behalf the Umrah is performed, as stated in the Hadith of Ibn Abbas
The proxy receives no reward at all for Umrah done on behalf of others; all the reward goes exclusively to the deceased person
The proxy must perform another Umrah for himself within the same year to receive the reward, otherwise only the deceased benefits

quizQuestions.explanation: Scholars differed on this issue. The first view is that the proxy receives reward like the deceased (Allah is generous). The second view is that the Hajj/Umrah reward goes to the deceased, while the proxy gets reward for kindness and separate worship acts. This is a matter of difference where we refer to Allah's knowledge.
quizQuestions.source: Various scholars including Ibn Hazm, Shaykh Muhammad ibn Ibrahim, Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin, and Fatwa Committee rulings

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a pilgrim in Ihram taking a bath for cleanliness and changing Ihram garments?

options.text: It is permissible to do ghusl for cleanliness and to change Ihram garments for cleaner ones, as the Prophet did ghusl when in Ihram
Bathing is only permitted once during Ihram, before Tawaf Al-Ifadah, and changing garments breaks the state of Ihram
Ghusl is prohibited except in case of major impurity, and Ihram garments must remain the same throughout Hajj
You can bathe but must use unscented water and cannot touch the Ihram garments with wet hands to avoid invalidating the Ihram

quizQuestions.explanation: It is permissible for the pilgrim in Ihram to do ghusl for cleanliness, because it is proven that the Prophet did ghusl when in Ihram. It is also permissible to change Ihram garments for cleaner or newer ones, and to use air conditioning and other means of comfort.
quizQuestions.source: Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin citing the practice of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him)

quizQuestions.questionText: Is it permissible to fast the Days of Tashriq to make up missed Ramadan fasts?

options.text: Fasting these days to make up missed Ramadan fasts is not valid and must be repeated, as these are days of eating and drinking with exception only for pilgrims without sacrificial animal
Making up missed fasts on Tashriq days is permissible and valid because obligatory fasts take precedence over the prohibition of voluntary fasting
You can fast the first two days of Tashriq for making up fasts, but the third day is absolutely prohibited for any type of fasting
The prohibition only applies to voluntary fasting; making up Ramadan fasts, fulfilling vows, and fasting for expiation are all permitted on Tashriq days
