quizQuestions.explanation: The Days of Tashriq (11th, 12th, 13th of Dhul-Hijjah) are days of eating and drinking, and fasting them is prohibited. The only exception is for pilgrims performing Tamattu` or Qiran who don't have a sacrificial animal. The majority of scholars say fasts on these days are invalid, whether optional, making up missed fasts, or vows.
quizQuestions.source: Muslim, Al-Bukhari, Shaykh Ibn Baz, Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin

quizQuestions.questionText: What should someone do if they have impermeable paint on their hands that prevents water from reaching the skin during wudoo?

options.text: He must remove anything that prevents water from reaching the skin before every wudoo, and people whose work involves paint should wear protection on their hands
He can wipe over the paint with wet hands three times, similar to wiping over leather socks, and this is valid for up to three days
If removing the paint causes hardship, he can perform tayammum instead of wudoo for that prayer, then remove it gradually over time
He must remove the paint only once a day before Fajr prayer, and the wudoo will remain valid for all five prayers even with paint on his hands

quizQuestions.explanation: The Muslim must make sure that water reaches his skin every time he does wudoo, and must remove anything that prevents this. People whose work involves painting and similar tasks can wear something on their hands to prevent them from getting covered with paint in the first place.
quizQuestions.source: General Islamic ruling on conditions of valid wudoo

quizQuestions.questionText: Is having an easy pregnancy a sign of special mercy from Allah according to authentic Islamic sources?

options.text: There is no saheeh Sunnah indicating easy pregnancy is a sign of special mercy; Allah's mercy may be in trials, and difficulty may bring reward and expiation of sins
The Hadith from Aisha about three signs of mercy including easy pregnancy is authentic, and difficult pregnancy indicates displeasure from Allah
Easy pregnancy is one of the signs mentioned in Sahih Muslim that a woman will enter Paradise directly without accountability
According to the scholars, a woman who has difficulty in pregnancy for three consecutive pregnancies should not have more children as this indicates Allah's prohibition

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing in the saheeh Sunnah indicating that easy pregnancy is a sign of special mercy. Allah's mercy may be in wellbeing or in trials according to His wisdom. The Hadith states that if a status is decreed, Allah may afflict in body/wealth/children to help attain it, and calamities expiate sins, so difficulty may be a sign of mercy and reward.
quizQuestions.source: Abu Dawood (classed as saheeh by Al-Albaani), Al-Bukhari, Muslim, and scholarly analysis

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic commercial law, when does liability for shipped goods transfer from the seller to the purchaser?

options.text: When the purchaser or his agent receives the goods and moves them from the seller's warehouse, even if still on a ship or plane
Only when the goods physically arrive at the purchaser's home or business location
As soon as the sale contract is signed, regardless of whether goods have been moved
When the shipping company takes possession, since they are professional carriers

quizQuestions.explanation: The goods become the liability of the purchaser when he himself, or his agent, receives them and takes possession, moving them from the seller's warehouses. This is true even if they are still on board a ship or plane, because by receiving and moving them, they become his liability. The Prophet () said 'Profit is connected to liability.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the technical definition of a mursal hadeeth according to hadith scholars?

options.text: A hadeeth narrated by a Taabi'i (successor) directly from the Prophet, skipping the Sahaabi (companion)
A hadeeth with a complete chain of narration back to the Prophet
A hadeeth narrated only by Sahaabah without any Taabi'een in the chain
A hadeeth that has been authenticated by all four major imams

quizQuestions.explanation: Imam al-Haakim stated there is no difference of opinion among hadith scholars that the mursal hadeeth is one which the muhaddith narrated with a complete isnaad back to the Taabi'i, and the Taabi'i says, 'The Messenger of Allah () said,' skipping mention of the Sahaabi.

quizQuestions.questionText: For someone who committed major sins but did not leave Islam, what is required according to Shaykh Ibn Baaz?

options.text: Sincere repentance according to the conditions is sufficient, without needing to renew the Shahaadatayn
They must pronounce the Shahaadatayn again regardless of the sin
They must perform Hajj to have their sins forgiven
They must fast for forty consecutive days as expiation

quizQuestions.explanation: As clarified in the answer, if what you have done is a major sin which does not take you out of Islam, then it is sufficient to repent according to the conditions. Only if you have done something that takes you out of Islam altogether must you pronounce the Shahaadatayn and re-enter Islam.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Ibn Katheer's interpretation, what does the Quranic phrase 'Allah is the third of the three' most likely refer to?

options.text: Christians making the Messiah and his mother Maryam into two gods with Allah, making Him the third of three
Christians believing in three separate creator gods from different religions
The concept of three angels who control the universe
A reference to three stages of human spiritual development

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn Katheer favored the interpretation that this verse was revealed concerning Christians making the Messiah and his mother into two gods with Allah, thus making Allah the third of three according to this concept. This is supported by the verse 'Did you say unto men: Worship me and my mother as two gods besides Allah?'

quizQuestions.questionText: Why did the Prophet () approve of Jaabir's decision to marry a previously-married woman instead of a virgin?

options.text: Because Jaabir had young sisters and needed a woman who could take care of them, discipline them, and comb their hair
Because virgins were not available for marriage in that time period
Because Jaabir was too old to marry a young virgin
Because the Prophet preferred all companions to marry widows exclusively

quizQuestions.explanation: Jaabir's father had died, leaving him with young sisters. He married a previously-married woman who could gather them together, comb their hair, take care of them, and discipline them. The Prophet approved this decision because of the specific circumstances and need.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Abdullah ibn Jibrin, when is it acceptable for a man to speak to his fiance?

options.text: Only with the woman's guardian's agreement, no objection to the marriage, talk limited to essential matters, and in a manner that doesn't provoke desire
Whenever they want as long as they avoid physical contact
Only in the presence of both sets of parents in the same room
It is never acceptable under any circumstances until after the marriage contract

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Jibrin specified that speaking must be done with the agreement of the woman's guardian with no objection to the marriage, the talk should not involve anything that may provoke desire, there should be no other way of communication, and it should not go beyond what is essential.

quizQuestions.questionText: Under what conditions is it permissible to give zakaah funds to a poor person for essential house repairs?

options.text: The house actually needs repairs (like fear of wall collapse or roof leaks), and repairs are appropriate to the poor person's situation without extravagance
Any type of home improvement including landscaping and decorative upgrades
Only if the entire house is being demolished and rebuilt from scratch
Only for repairs that cost less than 100 dirhams total

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer specifies two conditions: (1) The house actually needs those repairs, such as if there is fear of a wall collapsing or water leaking through the roof, and it is not solely for cosmetic purposes, and (2) The repairs should be appropriate to the situation of this poor person, without spending extravagantly.
tags: Where Zakah is to Be Spent

quizQuestions.questionText: According to al-Haafiz ibn Hajar and other scholars, what was one of the unique characteristics of the Prophet ()?

options.text: It was permissible for him to be alone with a non-mahram woman and to look at her, because he was protected by his infallibility
He was required to marry every woman he spoke to privately
He could never look at any woman other than his wives under any circumstances
He appointed male relatives to supervise all interactions with women

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Haafiz ibn Hajar stated: 'What is clear to us on the basis of strong evidence is that one of the unique characteristics of the Prophet () is that it was permissible for him to be alone with a non-mahram woman and to look at her.' This explains the story of Umm Haraam. Al-Bujayrami added this was 'because he was protected by his infallibility.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on calling upon the Prophet () after his death to meet one's needs or relieve distress?

options.text: It is major shirk that puts one beyond the pale of Islam
It is a minor sin that requires repentance but doesn't affect one's Islam
It is a recommended practice that brings one closer to Allah
It is permissible only on Fridays and during Ramadan

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars of the Standing Committee stated clearly: 'Calling upon the Prophet () and seeking his help after his death to meet one's needs or relieve one of distress is major Shirk that puts one beyond the pale of Islam.' This is because the Prophet himself did not possess any power to bring benefit or cause harm, except by the will of Allah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the conditions of sincere intention that a seeker of knowledge must maintain according to the answer?

options.text: Seeking the Face of Allah and the Home of the Hereafter, while avoiding showing off and competing with scholars
Seeking fame and recognition so that people will follow your guidance
Learning to prove oneself superior to the ignorant and earn a high salary
Studying only to please one's parents and meet family expectations

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer emphasizes: 'Let your aim be to seek the Face of Allah and the Home of the Hereafter. Beware of showing off and the love of making oneself appear to be superior to one's peers.' The Prophet () warned: 'Whoever seeks knowledge in order to compete with the scholars or to prove himself superior to the ignorant... Allah will cause him to enter Hell.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the three conditions that must be met when a person is forced to refer to man-made law courts to get back his rights?

options.text: He cannot get his rights except by this way, he should do it reluctantly and hate this way, and he should not take more than his due even if the law gives it to him
He must consult three scholars first, pay fidyah of feeding ten poor people afterwards, and avoid giving testimony in any future cases
The case must involve only commercial disputes not family matters, he must have written documentation of the Islamic ruling, and he needs two Muslim witnesses present
He should wait until after Ramadan to file the case, obtain written permission from the local imam, and limit his monetary claims to half the actual amount owed

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars of the Standing Committee stated three conditions for necessity cases: (1) He cannot get his rights except by this way, (2) He should do it reluctantly and hate this way of referring for judgement, and (3) He should not take more than his due, even if the law gives it to him.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Umar ibn al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him), how are the deeds of young children recorded by the angels?

options.text: The young child's good deeds will be recorded but his bad deeds will not be recorded
Both good and bad deeds are recorded equally in their books until they reach the age of puberty
Neither good deeds nor bad deeds are recorded before the child reaches seven years old
Only their obligatory acts like Friday prayers and Ramadan fasts are recorded in their book of deeds

quizQuestions.explanation: Umar ibn al-Khattab said: 'The young child's good deeds will be recorded but his bad deeds will not be recorded.' This is also supported by the hadith where the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) told the woman who asked about her child's Hajj: 'Yes, and you will be rewarded.'

quizQuestions.questionText: According to some scholars, what must a pregnant woman do if she fears for her baby only (not for herself) and breaks her Ramadan fast?

options.text: She must make up the fast later on and also pay the fidyah by feeding one poor person for each day not fasted
She only needs to make up the missed fasts after delivery, without any additional fidyah compensation required
She must pay double fidyah by feeding two poor people per day but is completely exempt from making up the missed days
She must fast two consecutive months after delivery as kaffarah expiation for breaking the fast

quizQuestions.explanation: Some scholars say that if the woman fears for her baby only, she must make up the fast later on AND pay the fidyah (feeding one poor person for each day), based on the report from Ibn Abbas about pregnant and nursing women. However, if she fears for herself, she only makes up the fast without fidyah.
tags: Fast of those who are exempted

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic law, who should make the determination that a missing person has died?

options.text: The qaadi (shari judge), or if there is no qaadi available, trustworthy scholars in the area who are qualified to issue fatwas should act in his stead
The family members after reaching unanimous agreement and presenting testimony from three reliable witnesses
Any registered Islamic center after verifying the absence for a minimum period of two complete years
The local imam after the Friday prayer congregation publicly confirms knowledge of the absence

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Uthaymeen stated it is essential to consult the qaadi to avoid chaos. If there is no qaadi or it is not possible to contact him, then scholars in the area should act in the stead of the qaadi as a matter of necessity, and one of the trustworthy scholars qualified to issue fatwas may rule, making his ruling binding like that of a judge.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to al-Shafi'i and Malik (in one report), when specifically should Qunut be recited during Ramadan?

options.text: Qunut should not be recited in Ramadan except in the second half of the month, as practiced by Ibn Umar and Muadh al-Qaari
Throughout the entire month of Ramadan from the first night to the last night with equal emphasis
Only on the odd-numbered nights when the imam is leading the congregation in Witr prayer
During the first ten days only, to match the timing of the best and most blessed days of Ramadan

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Shafi'i said: 'Qunut should not be recited in Ramadan except in the second half (of the month). This is what Ibn Umar and Muadh al-Qaari used to do.' The answer also mentions that al-Hasan reported that Umar united the people behind Ubayy ibn Ka'b, who led them for twenty nights during which he only recited Qunut in the second half.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, why might Muslim parents find it difficult to accept their son marrying a Western woman?

options.text: They may have heard about the widespread promiscuity in the West and the freedom with which Western women enter into relationships
Western women are categorically prohibited from learning the Arabic language and studying Islamic texts in depth
International immigration laws prevent Western spouses from visiting or traveling to Muslim-majority countries
All Western marriages by law require civil ceremonies which are explicitly forbidden in Islamic jurisprudence

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer states: 'The idea of their son marrying a western woman may be very strange for them and difficult to accept, especially if they have heard about the widespread promiscuity in the West and the freedom with which Western women enter into relationships.' Parents may also fear their son staying overseas and worry about raising children in a non-Islamic environment.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to those scholars who say that the one who does not pray is a kaafir (such as Imam Ahmad), what is the ruling on inheritance involving such a person?

options.text: He cannot inherit from others and others cannot inherit from him, just like other rulings that apply to apostates
He can inherit from Muslim relatives but is restricted to receiving only up to one-third of the total estate
He inherits his full share but must donate an equivalent portion to charity as expiation for abandoning prayer
His inheritance rights are suspended and held in trust until he begins praying the five daily prayers regularly

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states: 'For those who say that the one who does not pray is a kaafir...all the rulings on apostates apply to him. So he cannot inherit or be inherited from, he cannot be washed (after he dies), he cannot be buried in the Muslim graveyard, the funeral prayer cannot be offered for him, meat slaughtered by him is not halaal and his marriage contract becomes invalid.'

quizQuestions.questionText: In the hadith where the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wept when visiting Sa'd ibn 'Ubaadah, what did he say Allah does NOT punish for?

options.text: The tears of the eye and the grief of the heart
Momentary feelings of sadness that last less than three days following the death
Silent meditation and private reflection performed in the privacy of one's own home
Attending the funeral prayer and burial ceremony without speaking or making any sounds at all

quizQuestions.explanation: The hadith states: 'The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wept, and when the people saw the Prophet weeping, they also wept. He said: "Listen, Allah does not punish for the tears of the eye or the grief of the heart, rather He punishes for this"  and he pointed to his tongue  "or shows mercy (because of it)." This shows that simple crying is not forbidden, but wailing with the tongue is what is prohibited.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him), what is the principle regarding haram deeds and their effect on marriage prohibitions?

options.text: A haram deed does not make something permissible haram
Seven full years must pass before any marriages related to the haram deed become valid again
Haram deeds create temporary marriage prohibitions that last until sincere repentance is accepted by Allah
All blood relatives within three degrees of kinship become forbidden for marriage after committing zina

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn Abd al-Barr reported that Ibn Abbas said concerning this matter: 'A haram deed does not make something permissible haram.' This principle supports the view that zina with a woman does not make it haram to marry her mother or daughter, though scholars differed on this issue. The more correct view is that such marriages are permissible.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why is a man's wife's sister considered a non-mahram (stranger) to him in Islamic law?

options.text: Because if he were to divorce his wife, it would be permissible for him to marry her sister, proving she is not a mahram
She must continue wearing full hijab in his presence until the wife gives explicit written permission for interaction
Islamic law requires a minimum of five complete years of marriage before the sister can be considered mahram
The sister only becomes a mahram relative after the birth of the first child to the married couple

quizQuestions.explanation: The fatwa clearly states: 'Your wife's sister is a stranger (i.e. non-mahram) to you, because if you were to divorce your wife, it would be permissible for you to marry her (her sister). So she is not one of your mahrams.' This is why it is haram to be alone with her, and touching her with desire would break wudu.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a traveler do if they want to determine the qiblah direction on an airplane for obligatory prayers?

options.text: Ask the stewards about the direction of the qiblah
Wait until landing to pray the missed prayers
Use a compass they brought from home
Follow the direction the plane is heading

quizQuestions.explanation: The traveler must ask the stewards about the direction of the qiblah if the airplane does not have a sign showing it. If they do not ask, their prayer is not valid.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the Shaafa'is and Hanbalis, what happens if you deliberately swallow saliva after it reaches your lips during fasting?

options.text: It invalidates the fast because the saliva has separated from its usual place
It does not affect the fast as saliva is part of the body
It only invalidates if the saliva is mixed with food particles
It requires making up the day but no expiation

quizQuestions.explanation: The Shaafa'is and Hanbalis view that deliberately swallowing saliva after it reaches the lips invalidates the fast, because the saliva has separated from where it usually is (inside of the mouth), so swallowing it is like swallowing anything else that is separate from the body.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, what does the Arabic word 'Quran' come from?

options.text: The word 'al-qar' which means gathering and putting things together
The word 'qara'a' which means to read aloud
The word 'qirtas' which means paper or parchment
The word 'qarn' which means companion

quizQuestions.explanation: In Arabic, the word 'Quran' comes from the word meaning al-qar, which means 'gathering' and 'putting things together.' It is so called because it is a collection of all the suwar (plural of surah).

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say happens when people gather in one of the houses of Allah to recite the Book of Allah and study it together?

options.text: Tranquillity descends, angels surround them, mercy comes down, and Allah mentions them to those who are with Him
Their sins are immediately forgiven and their names are written among the righteous
They receive the reward of performing Hajj and Umrah
They are granted protection from trials for forty days

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'No group of people gathers in one of the houses of Allah to recite the Book of Allah and study it together, but tranquillity descends upon them, the angels surround them, mercy comes down upon them, and Allah mentions them to those who are with Him.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What condition is mentioned regarding distributing tapes as charity during condolence gatherings?

options.text: Not believing that giving charity during the mourning period has extra virtue beyond other times
Getting permission from all the deceased's family members first
Distributing only on the third day after death
Ensuring the tapes are recitations of specific Quranic chapters

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing wrong with distributing tapes during the condolence gathering, but that is subject to the condition that you do not believe that giving charity during the days of mourning is of extra virtue, as some people think that giving charity during the mourning period is essential to help the deceased.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the hadith mentioned, what happens to the person who fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward?

options.text: His previous sins will be forgiven
He will be granted a house in Paradise
He will be protected from trials for one year
His prayers will be accepted for forty days

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What does seeking the help of jinn or turning to them to fulfill one's desires constitute according to the answer?

options.text: Shirk or associating others in worship with Allah
A minor sin that requires repentance
An innovation (bid'ah) that should be avoided
A disliked action that reduces one's reward

quizQuestions.explanation: Seeking the help of the jinn or turning to them to fulfill one's desires is shirk or associating others in worship with Allah, because it is a kind of mutual benefitting whereby the jinn responds to the human's requests in return for the human's veneration.
tags: Belief in the Jinn, witchcraft and the evil eye

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, what is a major problem with the fabricated hadith about the five prayers?

options.text: It was not narrated by scholars of hadith with a saheeh isnad
It contradicts the number of daily prayers prescribed
It mentions prayers that were later abrogated
It attributes the prayers to Moses instead of Muhammad

quizQuestions.explanation: One of the obvious signs that the hadith is fabricated is that it was not narrated by the scholars of hadith with a saheeh isnad. It is a well known principle that any hadith that was not narrated with a saheeh isnad is to be rejected.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, whom is the wife obliged to obey?

options.text: Her husband
Her husband's parents
Both her husband and his parents equally
Whoever is the head of the household

quizQuestions.explanation: What the wife is obliged to do is to obey her husband; he is the one whom she is obliged to obey. If the husband agrees that she may visit her family, it does not matter if his parents do not approve.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on working in a satellite TV company that broadcasts both religious channels and immoral content?

options.text: It is not permissible and is haraam earnings
It is permissible as long as you work only on the religious channels
It is disliked but not forbidden if you need the income
It is permissible if you donate part of your salary to charity

quizQuestions.explanation: Working in this company is not permissible, and it is haraam earnings, because this company facilitates channels that promote immorality, deviation and misguidance. This is helping in sin and transgression, which Allah has forbidden.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on where the aqeeqah (sacrifice for a newborn) should be slaughtered?

options.text: No specific place is required; it can be slaughtered in any city as it is an act of worship for which no place is specified
It must be slaughtered in the city where the child was born
It must be slaughtered where there are poor people to receive the meat
It should be slaughtered at the nearest mosque to the family home

quizQuestions.explanation: There is no specific place for slaughtering the aqeeqah; it is permissible to slaughter it in the city where the child was born or elsewhere, because it is an act of worship for which no place is specified. The aqeeqah has the same ruling as udhiyah - it is mustahabb to eat from it, give some in charity, and give some as gifts to neighbors and friends.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, when did the congregational prayer on Laylat al-Nisf (mid-Sha'ban) first occur historically?

options.text: In Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) in 448 AH
In Makkah during the lifetime of the Prophet (peace be upon him)
In Madinah during the era of the rightly-guided Caliphs
In Damascus in 300 AH during the Umayyad period

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Fatni stated that the first time the congregational prayer on mid-Sha'ban occurred was in Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) in 448 AH. The scholars of the Hijaz, including Ata, Ibn Abi Mulaykah, and the fuqaha of Madinah, denounced this practice. There is no report that the Prophet or his Companions spent that night praying in congregation, making it an innovation (bid'ah).

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on reciting a verse from the Quran that contains a du'a while in prostration?

options.text: Permissible if the intention is to make du'a, not to recite Quran, following the principle that actions are judged by intentions
Completely forbidden in all cases because reciting Quran while prostrating is makrooh
Only allowed in voluntary prayers, not in obligatory prayers
Permissible only during the last third of the night in qiyam prayer

quizQuestions.explanation: If a person recites a du'a that is mentioned in the Quran when prostrating (such as 'Our Lord! Give us in this world that which is good...'), there is nothing wrong with that if the intention is to say du'a and not to recite Quran. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Actions are but by intentions.' The Standing Committee confirmed there is nothing wrong with this if done as du'a, not as Quran recitation.

quizQuestions.questionText: Under what circumstances is it permissible for a man to trim his eyebrows?

options.text: When the eyebrows fall over the eyes and prevent proper vision, they may be trimmed as much as needed to remove the problem
To make them look tidy and presentable for special occasions
When they become unusually thick and bushy
If one eyebrow is noticeably longer than the other

quizQuestions.explanation: It is not permissible for men to trim their eyebrows, just as it is not permissible for women. Trimming could affect every hair, which is worse than plucking. However, if the eyebrows are causing harm, such as falling over the eyes and preventing one from seeing properly, they may be trimmed as much as needed to remove the problem.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why are travelers not explicitly mentioned in the hadith 'Jumu'ah prayer is an obligatory duty for every Muslim except four'?

options.text: Mentioning a number does not necessarily mean it is limited to that number; travelers are mentioned in other authentic hadiths on the same subject
Travelers are actually required to attend Jumu'ah wherever they are
The hadith has an incomplete chain and the mention of travelers was lost
Travelers are included under the category of 'sick people' in the hadith

quizQuestions.explanation: Shari rulings should be derived from all hadiths on a subject, not just one. The Prophet mentioned a number to make the hadith easier to remember. Similar to the 'seven whom Allah will shade' hadith, which actually includes more than 20 categories when all hadiths are compiled. By examining all hadiths about Jumu'ah, scholars identified six categories exempt from it: children, slaves, women, sick people, travelers, and people of the wilderness.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is meant by the Prophet's instruction 'if the stars are mentioned, then keep quiet' in the context of speech to refrain from?

options.text: Seeking guidance by the stars concerning unseen matters through astrology, as the people of jahiliyyah did by using movements of heavenly bodies to predict earthly events
Discussing any astronomical observations or scientific studies of celestial bodies
Talking about constellations used for navigation on land or sea
Mentioning stars in poetry or literary descriptions of the night sky

quizQuestions.explanation: The prohibition refers to seeking guidance by the stars concerning matters that are unseen, as people of jahiliyyah used to do through astrology - using movements of heavenly bodies to indicate when earthly events would occur (wind, rainfall, price changes). They would claim that whoever got married or traveled under a particular star would have certain outcomes. This is distinct from using stars for permissible navigation purposes.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why is it impermissible to buy gold jewelry with paper money when payment is delayed?

options.text: Because paper money comes under the same ruling as gold and silver, and the hadith requires 'hand to hand' exchange on the spot
Because the delay causes uncertainty in the exact value of the gold at payment time
Because gold dealers may charge excessive markup for delayed payment arrangements
Because the buyer may change their mind and want to return the gold before full payment

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Gold for gold, silver for silver... like for like, same for same, hand to hand. But if these commodities differ, then sell as you like, as long as it is hand to hand.' Paper money comes under the same ruling as gold and silver. Delayed payment constitutes riba an-nasi'ah. However, if gold is purchased in return for other goods (fabric, food, etc.), then delay in payment is permissible.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why did the Prophet (peace be upon him) say 'the brother-in-law is death' when discussing women and non-mahram relatives?

options.text: Being alone with a brother-in-law may lead to disaster if a sin is committed, or may spell divorce if the husband cannot contain his jealousy
Brothers-in-law historically caused the most family disputes and conflicts in Arab society
The brother-in-law becomes a mahram after the first year of marriage
Physical proximity between in-laws always leads to impermissible relationships

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Nawawi explained that 'the brother-in-law is death' has several meanings: being alone may lead to disaster if sin is committed, or may spell divorce if the husband cannot contain jealousy. It also means: beware of being alone with a non-mahram woman - fear this as you fear death. This refers to all the husband's male relatives apart from his father and sons. People often take the matter of being alone with a brother-in-law lightly, hence the strong warning.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Shaykh Muhammad ibn Uthaymeen, under what conditions are credit cards permissible to use despite being based on riba conditions?

options.text: When it is certain that not using it causes difficulty with no other option, and the likelihood of being late in payment is remote
Only for business transactions exceeding a minimum threshold amount
When traveling internationally for hajj, umrah, or Islamic conferences
If the annual interest rate is below the market average rate

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Uthaymeen stated that if it is certain that not using the card will cause difficulty and there is no other option, and the likelihood of being late in payment is remote, then there is hope that there is nothing wrong with using it. Two conditions must be met: 1) Not using it causes difficulty with no alternative, and 2) The person is committed to paying it off without any delay to avoid interest charges.

quizQuestions.questionText: Why is it forbidden for a sick person to visualize who gave them the evil eye through the help of a qareen (jinn companion)?

options.text: It is seeking the help of shayateen, which creates enmity among people and causes fear and terror to be spread
The visualization produced by the jinn is always medically inaccurate and unreliable
Only qualified Islamic scholars with ijazah are permitted to perform this procedure
This method should only be used after three consecutive days of severe illness

quizQuestions.explanation: This is a devilish action that is not permitted because it involves seeking the help of shayateen. The jinn is the one who makes the sick person visualize the person who afflicted them with the evil eye. This is haraam because it creates enmity among people and causes fear and terror. It falls under the verse: 'And verily, there were men among mankind who took shelter with the males among the jinn, but they (jinn) increased them (mankind) in sin and transgression' [al-Jinn 72:6].

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on private chatting between the sexes on social media sites?

options.text: It is the same as physical khulwah and falls under the same prohibition discussed by the fuqaha
It does not come under the heading of khulwah discussed by fuqaha, but is disallowed as a means that leads to fitnah and mischief
It is completely permissible since the Shaytaan cannot be the third one present in online conversations
It is only forbidden if the conversation involves exchanging photographs

quizQuestions.explanation: While private chatting on social media does not come under the heading of the khulwah (physical seclusion) forbidden in hadith, it is still disallowed because it is a means that leads to fitnah and mischief. Such contact should be avoided unless for a greater religious purpose (like asking questions of scholars) or legitimate worldly need, in which case conversation should be only as much as needed without unnecessary chitchat.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the scholars, what is the defining characteristic of the siddeeqoon?

options.text: They are those who memorized the entire Quran and never forgot any verse
They are those who reached the highest levels of faith, righteous deeds, beneficial knowledge and true certainty
They are the first generation of Muslims who accompanied the Prophet in Makkah
They are those who gave all their wealth in charity for the sake of Allah

quizQuestions.explanation: The siddeeqoon are those who reached the highest levels of faith, righteous deeds, beneficial knowledge and true certainty. As-Sa'di stated this definition. The highest level of sincerity is that of the siddeeq, which is perfect submission to the Messenger accompanied by perfect sincerity towards the One Who sent him. The siddeeq confirms with his actions what he says with his tongue.

quizQuestions.questionText: If a wife says to her husband 'You are haraam to me until the Day of Judgement', what is the required expiation?

options.text: She must observe the waiting period of zihaar and the marriage is suspended
Freeing a slave, or feeding or clothing ten poor persons, or fasting three days if unable to do either
She must pay a fine equivalent to the mahr and seek her husband's forgiveness
The marriage is automatically dissolved and they must perform a new marriage contract

quizQuestions.explanation: This statement does not result in zihaar or talaaq (which can only be done by the husband). Rather it comes under the heading of making what is halaal haraam, which is treated as a type of oath. The expiation for breaking this oath is freeing a slave, or feeding or clothing ten poor persons (each receiving half a saa' of food or garments acceptable for praying in), or fasting three days if unable to do either. She only breaks the oath if her husband has intercourse with her when she is willing.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a person do with investment certificates in an Islamic bank after discovering the bank invests in riba-based treasury bills?

options.text: Wait until the certificates expire naturally to avoid financial losses, then not renew them
Stop investing immediately and cancel the certificates, even if it results in losing money
Continue investing but donate all profits to charity to purify the earnings
Transfer the certificates to a current account within the same bank to avoid riba

quizQuestions.explanation: A person must stop investing in the bank immediately, whether through investment accounts or limited-time certificates, even if that results in losing some money. This is to flee from dealing with riba and in obedience to Allah's command: 'O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of interest, if you should be believers.' The Prophet cursed the one who consumes riba, the one who pays it, the one who writes it down and the two who witness it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling if a man gives preference to his wife over his mother in spending and necessities?

options.text: It is sinful and he must always give preference to his mother in all matters
There is no sin if his mother's needs are met, but it is better to give preference to his mother and hide any preference given to wife
He must divide all spending equally between his mother and wife regardless of their needs
He should give all his wealth to his mother first, then whatever remains goes to his wife

quizQuestions.explanation: There is no sin involved in giving preference to his wife over his mother, if his mother is one of those whom he is obliged to support and he meets her needs. However, it is better for him to make his mother happy and to give her preference. If he has to give preference to his wife, he should hide that from his mother.
tags: Spending on those under ones responsibility

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on using medicines to permanently change skin color from dark to white?

options.text: Temporary whitening using creams is permissible, but permanent change is not permissible as it is changing the creation of Allah
Both temporary and permanent whitening are completely permissible for beautification purposes
All forms of skin whitening are forbidden whether temporary or permanent
Permanent whitening is only permissible if done through surgical procedures, not medicines

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing wrong with changing the color of the skin temporarily using creams and cosmetic preparations. But if it is permanently changing the color of the skin, then it is not permissible, whether by surgical procedures or other means, because that is changing the creation of Allah. Shaykh Ibn Uthaymin stated that permanent whitening is prohibited as it is akin to tattooing and filing the teeth. However, using permissible medicines to restore skin to its original color (removing a defect) is not considered changing Allah's creation.

quizQuestions.questionText: When were the five daily prayers made obligatory in their current form?

options.text: At the very beginning of the Prophet's mission in Makkah
On the night of Isra' and Mi'raj, one and a half years before the Hijrah, originally fifty prayers reduced to five
After the Hijrah to Madinah when the Muslim community was established
Gradually over several years, with one prayer added each year until reaching five

quizQuestions.explanation: The five daily prayers were made obligatory on the night of the Isra' and Mi'raj, one and a half years before the Hijrah. Allah enjoined fifty prayers which were reduced to five (each with a tenfold reward making it fifty). Jibril came down on the morning following that night and taught the Prophet the times of the prayers. When first made obligatory, each prayer was two rak'ahs; after the Hijrah, this was confirmed for travel but became four rak'ahs for residents except Maghrib.

quizQuestions.questionText: What should a Muslim woman do if she fears failing her medical school exam because of wearing hijab?

options.text: She may temporarily remove hijab for exams only, then put it back on afterwards
She should adhere to her religion and keep her hijab, even if that means giving up her studies
She should wait until she finishes her studies completely, then wear hijab after graduation
She may wear a modified version of hijab that is more acceptable to her examiners

quizQuestions.explanation: The Muslim woman is obliged to wear hijab in front of non-mahram men based on clear evidence. It is not permissible to take off hijab because of studying, because that is not a necessity that permits doing something Allah has forbidden. She should adhere to her religion and keep her hijab, even if that means giving up her studies. Whoever puts his trust in Allah, Allah will suffice him and protect him. The Prophet said about those who adhere to Islam in difficult times that they will have the reward of fifty martyrs.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic law, what is the basic principle regarding commands and prohibitions for males and females?

options.text: Males have more prohibitions than females to account for their greater strength and responsibility
There is no differentiation between males and females with regard to commands and prohibitions as a basic principle
Females have stricter prohibitions than males because they need more protection
Each gender has completely separate and distinct sets of commands and prohibitions

quizQuestions.explanation: The basic principle with regard to the commands and prohibitions is that there is no differentiation between males and females. Both the male thief and female thief have their hands cut off; both fornicators receive the same punishment; both are commanded to lower their gaze and protect their private parts. In fact, some things are forbidden for men but permissible for women (like silk and gold). Allah says whoever does righteous deeds, male or female, and is a believer will enter Paradise without the least injustice.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the fate of disbelievers who hear the message of the Prophet but do not enter Islam?

options.text: They will go to Hell, as stated in the hadith about anyone who hears of the Prophet but dies without believing
They will enter Paradise if their morals are good and they do not harm anyone
They will remain in an intermediate state between Paradise and Hell based on their deeds
They will be given another chance on the Day of Judgment to accept Islam before their final fate is decided

quizQuestions.explanation: All disbelievers who hear the message of the Prophet and do not enter Islam will go to Hell. The Prophet said: 'By the One in Whose hand is my soul, no one of this nation, Jew or Christian, hears of me then dies without having believed in that with which I was sent, but he will be one of the people of the Fire.' The point is not whether their morals are good, but whether they submit to Allah and obey His commands. Those who worship other than Allah or associate partners with Him are being ill-mannered towards Allah.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did 'Umar ibn al-Khattab say about who should sell in the marketplace?

options.text: No one should sell in our marketplace except those who have knowledge of Islam
No one should sell in our marketplace except those who have wealth
No one should sell in our marketplace except those who have a license
No one should sell in our marketplace except those who have experience

quizQuestions.explanation: 'Umar ibn al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) said: 'No one should sell in our marketplace except those who have knowledge of Islam.' This was narrated by al-Tirmidhi (487) and classed as hasan by al-Albani. This emphasizes that merchants must learn the rulings on trade before engaging in commerce.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say about a woman who gets married without the permission of her guardian?

options.text: Her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid
Her marriage is valid but makrooh
Her marriage requires renewal of vows
Her marriage is suspended until the guardian approves

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (blessings and peace of Allah be upon him) said: 'Any woman who gets married without the permission of her guardian, her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid, her marriage is invalid.' This hadith was narrated by Ahmad (24417), Abu Dawood (2083) and al-Tirmidhi (1102), and classed as saheeh by al-Albaani.

quizQuestions.questionText: How many pests did the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) mention that may be killed whether one is in Ihram or not?

options.text: Five pests: rats, scorpions, crows, kites, and mad dogs, with another report adding snakes as a sixth
Three pests: rats, scorpions, and snakes
Seven pests including ants and cockroaches
Four pests: rats, scorpions, crows, and snakes

quizQuestions.explanation: The Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: 'There are five pests that may be killed whether one is in Ihram or not: rats, scorpions, crows, kites [a hawk-like bird], and mad dogs.' Another report adds a sixth, which is snakes. This was reported by Muslim (2071).

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the Prophet's hadith, what should be done if the new moon is not sighted due to clouds?

options.text: Reckon the month as thirty days
Wait until it is sighted the next night
Rely on astronomical calculations
Follow the sighting from the nearest country

quizQuestions.explanation: The Prophet (blessings and peace of Allah be upon him) said: 'Fast when you see it (the new moon) and break the fast when you see it, and if it is cloudy then reckon the month as thirty.' This hadith was narrated by al-Bukhari (1909) and Muslim (1081). This means if Sha'ban's moon cannot be sighted, complete it as 30 days then start Ramadan.

quizQuestions.questionText: Who was al-Namrood according to the Quran and Islamic sources?

options.text: The kaafir king of Babylon who disputed with Ibrahim about his Lord
The king who threw the believing boy into the fire
The king who had a court sorcerer and monk
The king who ordered ditches to be dug for believers

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Namrood was the king of Babylon, and he was a kaafir king. Allah describes what happened between him and Ibrahim in al-Baqarah 2:258, where Ibrahim said 'My Lord is He Who gives life and causes death' and al-Namrood claimed 'I give life and cause death.' The story of the boy and the ditches is about the people of the ditch, not al-Namrood.

quizQuestions.questionText: What happened when people were praying Fajr in Quba' and someone told them that revelation came commanding them to face the Ka'bah?

options.text: They were facing towards Syria, so they turned to face the Ka'bah during the prayer
They completed the prayer facing Syria then repeated it facing the Ka'bah
They stopped the prayer and started a new one facing the Ka'bah
They waited until after the prayer to change direction

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the hadith narrated by al-Bukhaari (403) and Muslim (526) from Abdullah ibn Umar: whilst the people were praying Fajr in Quba', someone came and told them revelation came commanding them to face the Ka'bah. They were facing towards Syria, so they turned to face the Ka'bah during the prayer. This shows permissibility of movement during prayer if it's in the interests of the prayer.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did 'Umar ibn al-Khattab say to a young man about his lower garment?

options.text: Lift up your lower garment for it will make your garment last longer and is more obedient to your Lord
Lift up your lower garment or you will be prevented from entering the mosque
Lift up your lower garment to avoid tripping on it
Lift up your lower garment to show respect to elders

quizQuestions.explanation: 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said to the young man whom he saw allowing his garment to hang below his ankles during his final sickness: 'O young man, lift up your lower garment for it will make your garment last longer and is more obedient to your Lord.' This shows both the practical benefit and the religious obligation of avoiding isbaal.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the answer, what are the five matters that complete a person's knowledge?

options.text: Knowing Allah, knowing His names and attributes, knowing the way to reach Him, knowing the obstacles, and knowing yourself
Knowing the Quran, knowing hadith, knowing fiqh, knowing aqeedah, and knowing Arabic
Knowing prayer, knowing fasting, knowing zakah, knowing hajj, and knowing jihad
Knowing history, knowing science, knowing philosophy, knowing ethics, and knowing religion

quizQuestions.explanation: Full knowledge can only be attained by knowing the following five matters: 1) Knowing Allah, the Creator and Provider, 2) Knowing the names and attributes of Allah and their effect, 3) Knowing the way to reach Him, 4) Knowing the obstacles that prevent man from knowing this way, and 5) Knowing yourself in a true sense, what your soul needs, what is good and bad for it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on charging fees for a covered (prepaid) credit card versus a non-covered credit card?

options.text: For covered cards, the company may charge higher than actual costs, but for non-covered cards, only actual costs are allowed
Both types can charge fees higher than actual costs
Both types should only charge actual costs
For non-covered cards fees can be higher, but for covered cards only actual costs

quizQuestions.explanation: There is nothing wrong with the company charging a fee higher than actual cost for a covered/prepaid credit card, as this is a fee for offering a service. However, for a non-covered credit card, charging more than actual costs is not allowed because the bank is giving a loan to the customer, and it's not permissible to charge interest or profit on a loan.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say about punishing with fire?

options.text: No one punishes with fire except Allah
Punishing with fire is permissible for severe crimes
Punishing with fire is allowed for apostates only
Punishing with fire is permissible in cases of qisaas

quizQuestions.explanation: According to the hadith narrated by al-Bukhaari (3016), the Messenger of Allah (blessings and peace of Allah be upon him) said: 'I had commanded you to burn So and so, and So and so. But verily no one punishes with fire except Allah. So if you find them, execute them.' This establishes the prohibition on punishment by burning.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Islamic teachings about dealing with internet rumors, what is the proper methodology for accepting news?

options.text: Accept news that coincides with our hopes and wishes
Verify news from authentic sources and be cautious about anonymous sources
Believe news if it comes with pictures from the battlefield
Accept news from unknown sources if our intention is good

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer emphasizes that we must be certain about news we accept and not accept it simply because it coincides with our hopes. We must verify matters from authentic sources and be cautious about anonymous sources. An old proverb says, 'Whoever pursues weird news will be disbelieved.'

quizQuestions.questionText: When someone swears multiple oaths about the same matter and then breaks them, how many expiations (kaffarah) are required?

options.text: One expiation regardless of how many times the oath was repeated
An expiation for each time the oath was sworn
No expiation needed if the oaths were said on the same day
Two expiations to be on the safe side

quizQuestions.explanation: If all oaths had to do with the same thing, then expiation only needs to be offered once. For example, if you said 'By Allah, I will not speak to So and so' many times, then you spoke to him, you only have to offer expiation once. But if you swore oaths regarding several different things, then for each oath you have to offer expiation.

quizQuestions.questionText: What are the two types of terrorism (irhaab) distinguished in Islamic teaching?

options.text: Praiseworthy terrorism that scares enemies to prevent attack, and blameworthy terrorism that scares innocent people
Physical terrorism and psychological terrorism
Individual terrorism and collective terrorism
Defensive terrorism and offensive terrorism

quizQuestions.explanation: Praiseworthy terrorism refers to scaring an enemy lest he attack the Muslims and occupy their land, involving being fully prepared and armed. Blameworthy terrorism refers to scaring those who do not deserve to be scared: Muslims or others whose lives are protected by Islamic law, such as those who have a covenant with Muslims.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to the majority of scholars, when is it recommended (Sunnah) to renew wudu?

options.text: When you have already prayed with your previous wudu
Anytime you want, regardless of whether you prayed with it
Only before obligatory prayers, not voluntary ones
Only when your wudu has been invalidated

quizQuestions.explanation: The most correct view is that renewing wudu is Sunnah if the person prayed with the wudu he did previously. For example, if someone did wudu for Zuhr and prayed Zuhr, then the time for Asr came and he was still in a state of purity, it is Sunnah for him to do a new wudu. If he did not pray with the first wudu, then renewing it is not prescribed.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is one of the main concerns scholars have expressed about Jama'at al-Tabligh?

options.text: They do not have proper understanding of the issues of correct Islamic creed (aqidah)
They encourage Muslims to abandon all voluntary prayers
They forbid Muslims from seeking any Islamic knowledge
They only focus on fasting and ignore other pillars of Islam

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Baz stated that Jama'at al-Tabligh do not have proper understanding of the issues of aqidah, so it is not permissible to go out with them except for one who has knowledge and understanding of the correct aqidah of Ahl al-Sunnah wa'l-Jama'ah, so that he can guide them and advise them. Among their mistakes listed: not adopting the aqidah of Ahl al-Sunnah and not paying attention to shari knowledge.
tags: Qualities of one who calls people to Islam

quizQuestions.questionText: What do the scholars say about a woman in ihram keeping her face covering away from touching her face?

options.text: It is not required; the covering may touch her face without blame
She must use a stick or her hand to keep distance between the covering and face
The covering must be at least one hand's width away from her face
She should keep it away only when performing tawaf

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn Baz said: It is permissible for the woman in ihram to let her head cover down over her face if she needs to do so, without using anything to lift it off her face. If the head cover touches her face, there is no blame on her. Using a stick under the head cover to lift it off the face has no basis in sharee'ah. Aisha reported that women would let down their jilbabs over their faces when riders passed, and it inevitably touches the face.
tags: Things which are not allowed in Ihraam

quizQuestions.questionText: Who is meant by 'the companion of the Quran' in the hadith about reading and ascending in Paradise?

options.text: The one who consistently recites the Quran and acts upon it
Anyone who has read the Quran at least once in their life
Only those who have memorized the entire Quran by heart
Those who read the Quran frequently but do not act upon it

quizQuestions.explanation: The scholars explained that 'the companion of the Quran' means the one who consistently recites it and acts upon it, not the one who reads it and does not act upon it. The greater reward will not be attained except by one who memorized the Quran, learned how to recite it properly, AND acts upon it. Most of the Companions memorized the Quran in the sense of acting upon it.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on a girl corresponding with a young man who is not a mahram through pen pal corners?

options.text: Not permissible because it leads to fitnah (temptation) and corruption
Permissible if they discuss only Islamic knowledge and religious topics
Permissible as long as the girl's parents are informed and approve
Discouraged but not explicitly forbidden in Islam

quizQuestions.explanation: It is not permissible to correspond with a young man who is not a mahram through what is known as the 'Pen pal corner', because that is something that leads to fitnah (temptation) and to evil and corruption. The ruling is clear and unambiguous.

quizQuestions.questionText: If someone puts on socks after doing wudu, then does tayammum due to illness, then the illness ends and they do wudu for the next prayer, what is the ruling on wiping over the socks?

options.text: Permissible to wipe over them as there is no evidence that tayammum invalidates this concession
The socks must be removed and put on again after the new wudu
Tayammum invalidates the permission to wipe over the socks during that period
They must wash the feet thoroughly even while the socks remain on

quizQuestions.explanation: If someone put socks on when in a state of purity, then did tayammum after that, then the excuse that made tayammum permissible was no longer applicable, so he did wudu and wiped over his socks, there is nothing wrong with that. There is no report from the Prophet to suggest that doing tayammum during the period in which wiping over the socks is permissible invalidates the concession. The basic principle is that things remain as they are and cannot be changed except on the basis of evidence.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on performing sujud as-sahw (prostration of forgetfulness) in voluntary (nafl) prayers?

options.text: It is prescribed just as in obligatory prayers according to the majority of scholars
It is not allowed in voluntary prayers according to scholarly consensus
It is only required in Witr prayer, not in other nafl prayers
It is optional and has no basis in the Sunnah

quizQuestions.explanation: It is prescribed to do sujud as-sahw in nafl (supererogatory) prayers just as it is prescribed to do it in the obligatory prayers when there is a reason for doing it. This is the view of the majority of scholars because of the general meaning of the Prophet's words: 'If any one of you forgets, let him do two prostrations.' Ibn Abbas did two prostrations after Witr, and Witr is not obligatory, which indicates that sujud as-sahw should be done in both obligatory and nafl prayers.

quizQuestions.questionText: How many conditions must an act of worship meet to be in accordance with Shari'ah?

options.text: Six conditions: reason, type, amount, manner, time, and place
Four conditions: reason, type, amount, and manner
Five conditions: type, amount, manner, time, and place
Three conditions: reason, manner, and time

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Muhammad ibn Salih ibn 'Uthaymin, an act of worship must be in accordance with Shari'ah in six aspects: (1) reason, (2) type or nature, (3) amount, (4) manner of doing it, (5) timing, and (6) place where it is done.

quizQuestions.questionText: What is the ruling on clenching fingers to count rak'ahs during prayer according to Shaykh Ibn Baaz?

options.text: There is nothing wrong with it; it is a small movement in the interests of the prayer
It is makrooh because it involves unnecessary movement during prayer
It invalidates the prayer because it is too much movement
It is only allowed in voluntary prayers, not obligatory ones

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh 'Abd al-'Azeez ibn Baaz stated that there is nothing wrong with clenching one or two fingers so as not to forget. He explained it is a small movement that is in the interests of the prayer, so it is excused.

quizQuestions.questionText: What evidence do scholars cite for the permissibility of appointing someone to take over as imam during prayer?

options.text: When 'Umar was stabbed while praying, he took 'Abd al-Rahman ibn 'Awf's hand and made him lead the remainder of the prayer
The Prophet (peace be upon him) appointed Abu Bakr to take over when he was ill
'Ali ibn Abi Talib appointed his son to complete the prayer when he became sick
Ibn 'Abbas narrated that the Prophet allowed changing imams mid-prayer

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer specifically mentions that when 'Umar ibn al-Khattab was stabbed as he was praying, he took the hand of 'Abd al-Rahman ibn 'Awf and made him move forward to lead the people in the remainder of the prayer. This was done in the presence of the Sahabah with no objection, establishing consensus.

quizQuestions.questionText: What does Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah say about the prostration of all created beings?

options.text: Everything prostrates according to its nature, not by putting foreheads on the ground
All creatures prostrate exactly like humans do, on seven parts of the body
Prostration of non-human creatures is metaphorical, not real prostration
Only living creatures prostrate; inanimate objects do not truly prostrate

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn Taymiyah stated: 'It is known that everything prostrates according to its nature, and the prostration of these created entities does not mean that they put their foreheads on the ground.' He explained that prostration is a form of humility, and each creature prostrates in a manner appropriate to it.

quizQuestions.questionText: If a man and woman hold hands and kiss after the marriage contract but before consummation, what is the ruling?

options.text: There is no sin, because by the marriage contract the woman becomes the wife of the man
It is haram and they must repent and offer expiation
It is makrooh but not sinful since they are engaged
It is only permissible if they have parental permission

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clearly states: 'If this is what is referred to in the question, then there is no sin on you for what happened between you, because simply by doing the marriage contract, the woman becomes the wife of the man and there is no sin on either of them for enjoying the other.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What did the Prophet (peace be upon him) prescribe to do after the burial of the deceased is finished?

options.text: Stand at the graveside and say: 'Pray for forgiveness for your brother and ask for him to be made steadfast, for now he is being questioned'
Recite 'Laa ilaaha ill-Allah, al-daayim wajh-Allah' audibly
Say 'Yaa Rahmaan, yaa Rahmaan' at the time of burial
Remain silent and ponder one's own fate without speaking

quizQuestions.explanation: According to Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymeen, when the burial of the deceased was finished, the Prophet would stand at the graveside and say: 'Pray for forgiveness for your brother and ask for him to be made steadfast, for now he is being questioned.' This is what is prescribed in Islam.

quizQuestions.questionText: What conditions do scholars require for using poison or venom for medicinal purposes?

options.text: It must be prescribed by a skilled doctor, proven to be beneficial, used safely, and have no alternative treatment available
It is only allowed in life-threatening emergencies with no other options
It requires approval from three doctors and must be diluted to 10% concentration
It can be used freely as long as the patient gives informed consent

quizQuestions.explanation: Al-Mawsu'ah al-Fiqhiyyah states it is permissible 'provided that it can be used in a safe way and there is the hope that it will be beneficial, by way of choosing the less harmful of two options and warding off the greater harm, on condition that you seek the advice of a Muslim doctor of good character, or you have good knowledge of what can be used for medicinal purposes, and there is no alternative that could treat the problem.'

quizQuestions.questionText: For whom is ghusl on the day of 'Arafah prescribed according to the scholars?

options.text: Only for pilgrims performing Hajj, as it is bathing for gathering with people in 'Arafah
For all Muslims worldwide, whether performing Hajj or not
Only for those in Makkah and the surrounding areas
For pilgrims and Muslims who fast on the day of 'Arafah

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer clarifies: 'It should be understood that doing ghusl for the day of 'Arafah is not for every Muslim; rather it is only for the pilgrim, because this is what is narrated from the Sahabah (may Allah be pleased with them), and because it is bathing for the purpose of gathering with people, and the gathering only takes place in 'Arafah.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What examples does the answer give of cooperating in sin and transgression?

options.text: Renting stores to riba-based banks, helping manufacture haraam products, or enabling followers of bid'ah to speak to Muslims
Teaching English to someone with incorrect beliefs, working for non-Muslim employers, or selling permissible goods
Lending money without interest, selling food to non-Muslims, or teaching general knowledge
Working in technology, teaching languages, or providing professional services

quizQuestions.explanation: The answer specifically states: 'Examples of cooperating in sin and transgression include: renting out stores to riba-based banks or stores that sell haraam things, joining a businessman in manufacturing, selling or buying haraam things, or helping followers of bid'ah (innovation) financially or by enabling them to speak to the Muslims, and so on.'

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymin say about a woman who has applied henna to her hands or feet?

options.text: She must cover them whether she has applied henna or not when non-mahram men are around
She may show her hands but must cover her feet at all times
She only needs to cover henna if it is brightly colored or decorative
She may show henna to elderly non-mahram men but not young ones

quizQuestions.explanation: Shaykh Ibn 'Uthaymin stated: 'she must cover her hands, although covering the hands is what is prescribed for a woman if there are non-mahram men around her, whether she has applies henna to them or not.' This emphasizes that covering is required regardless of henna.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to scholars, what are the two specific reasons it is better not to name a daughter 'Malaak'?

options.text: The meaning 'malak' (angel) contains exaggeration when applied to a person, and it is a name well-known among Christians who pronounce 'malak' as 'Malaak'
The name is too difficult for non-Arabic speakers to pronounce, and it may cause confusion with other similar-sounding names
The name was used by pre-Islamic Arabs in idol worship, and it has negative historical associations in Islamic texts
The name suggests perfection that only prophets possess, and it was specifically prohibited in an authentic hadith

quizQuestions.explanation: Scholars advise against the name Malaak for two reasons: (1) Its meaning 'malak' (angel) involves an element of exaggeration when given to a person, and (2) it is a name well-known among Christians, who pronounce the word 'malak' as 'Malaak'. There are many good names without such doubtful elements that should be used instead.

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Anas ibn Maalik report about how the Sahaabah recited during the Farewell Pilgrimage with the Prophet (peace be upon him)?

options.text: Among them were some who recited 'Allaahu akbar', some who recited 'Laa ilaaha ill-Allaah', and some who recited the Talbiyah - each person reciting by himself
They all recited the Talbiyah in perfect unison following the Prophet's lead, creating a harmonious chorus heard throughout Makkah
The men recited 'Allaahu akbar' while the women recited the Talbiyah, following the Prophet's specific instructions for gender separation
They alternated between reciting Quranic verses and the Talbiyah, with each group taking turns to lead the recitation

quizQuestions.explanation: Anas ibn Maalik reported that during the Farewell Pilgrimage, the Companions were with the Prophet and among them were some who recited 'Allaahu akbar', some who recited 'Laa ilaaha ill-Allaah', and some who recited the Talbiyah. This demonstrates that each person should recite the Talbiyah by himself and not pay attention to what others are reciting, rather than reciting in unison.
tags: Mistakes made by pilgrims performing Hajj and 'Umrah

quizQuestions.questionText: What did Ali ibn Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him) himself say about those who claimed he was better than Abu Bakr and Umar?

options.text: He said 'The best of this ummah after its Prophet is Abu Bakr then Umar' and 'No one is brought to me who prefers me over them, but I will whip him with the hadd punishment for telling lies'
He remained silent on this matter to avoid causing division among Muslims, though he privately believed he had been wronged by the Sahabah
He acknowledged that while Abu Bakr was chosen first, the Prophet had secretly appointed him as the true successor through hidden texts
He accepted Abu Bakr's leadership but maintained that the Prophet had given him special spiritual authority that transcended political succession

quizQuestions.explanation: Mutawaatir reports from Ali show that he used to say 'The best of this ummah after its Prophet is Abu Bakr then Umar.' He also said 'No one is brought to me who prefers me over them, but I will whip him with the hadd punishment for telling lies.' Ali never claimed to be the best of the ummah or that the Messenger appointed him as khaleefah, and he never said the Sahabah wronged him.

quizQuestions.questionText: According to Ibn Abbaas's interpretation reported by Ibn Abi Haatim, what do the three different time spans mentioned in the Quran (a day of 1,000 years in al-Hajj, a day of 1,000 years in al-Sajdah, and a day of 50,000 years in al-Ma'arij) refer to?

options.text: Al-Hajj refers to one of the six days Allah created the heavens and earth, al-Sajdah refers to the time for a matter to ascend to Allah, and al-Ma'arij refers to the Day of Resurrection
All three verses refer to the Day of Resurrection, with the difference in time span depending on whether a person is a believer or a disbeliever
Al-Hajj refers to the journey of the soul after death, al-Sajdah refers to the period of the barzakh, and al-Ma'arij refers to the final judgment
All three verses use symbolic numbers to indicate that Allah's time is beyond human comprehension and cannot be measured by earthly standards

quizQuestions.explanation: Ibn Abbaas's interpretation, as reported by Ibn Abi Haatim via Sammaak and Ikrimah, states that: the day of a thousand years in Soorat al-Hajj is one of the six days in which Allah created the heavens and earth; the day of a thousand years in Soorat al-Sajdah is the length of time for a matter to go up to Allah; and the day of fifty thousand years is the Day of Resurrection. This is one of two ways scholars have reconciled these verses.
